text:
This's not my first time here, the sushi is great but you need to overlook the waiter he's totally rude. He wouldn't let me finish what I need to order, he drove me  crazy. 
The sushi and the price is good.

Sasa sushi became our go to spot, I was always there with my family or sisters.... 
A regular. 
I will never go again!!! First of all waitress both of them were drunk or on something 
I was ignored sat myself down they took 30 min to notice us I stood up to grab my own menus!?!?  they didn't take our order due to the fact that they were busy taking shots and drinking beer..... Employees wasted on the job. 
And i asked for my check they ignored us 3 times, I could have walked out with out paying... 
Then to top off the night, I was walking out waitress threw up outside in front of the restaurant..... 
It was really bad, I never ever review any business and this was just so disappointing. 
:(

I've been to a lot of sushi places out here in Vegas, even some at the casinos. This place is by far one of the best sushi places in town. I eat here at least once a week and never had a bad experience. I see people complain on here and think to myself, they were probably born that way cause there are a lot of complainers out here anyways. You can't beat the price or the quality. Good job Nick and crew.
I had the lunch time box meal and for $14:00 it was not only a bargain but very tasty and very filling. I can't wait to order from here again.

It looks like the only bad reviews are when people go on Friday nights. We loved this place and then....we didn't.  I'm totally cool with mistakes were all human but it was almost like they were doing it on purpose? It wasn't just one thing it was numerous things like placing a tempura shrimp in a hand roll with the tail pointing up in the first bite what really? The octopus was so thick it couldn't be chewed literally had to spit out in my napkin (the ones I usually have to go in the back to get myself, on more than one occasion) Then we ordered a couple of special items (they made us these dishes on their own for us to try when we were trying this place out) fail. If you make someone something special to try and they like it, and they order again and again and then it's not the same or even close to all the other times ... What changed? People like consistency We were so disappointed. FOH servers are below average, it's like they do the bare minimum I've seen tables leave due to lack of attention, there is no consistency here.

We drop $75-80 for two AYCE  that always included 20% tip! We never overstay or overheat and are pretty low maintenance. So now we have to find a new place to drop that money. 

I love it when people break up and say it's not you, it's me. In this case it's you!

Goodbye
I'm not very impressed with the food, my server seemed like he didn't want to be there. I honestly wanted to walk out, you need to have a good vibe as a server not a "dead i dont wanna be here vibe".

The photos for this place on previous reviews lied. I'm writing this review to state that I got the smallest cut of Tuna that I've ever seen. Place sux. Really? How can u serve cut of sushi the size of a mailbox key? So what if its AYCE? Took 4 pcs to equal one normal piece anywhere else. Really? Still haven't gotten an order I placed 45 minutes ago. Server disclosed she was from AZ. I don't care where ur from if u can remember an order.  I was patient.  I asked nicely after 30 minutes.  Now I'm writing this review just becuz it was so comical. Sushi rice is like sludge. Cuts are smaller than I've ever seen in my life... ANYWHERE. Can't stand stingy places.

This was horrible... brought my wife for her birthday no one helped us we grabed our own menus after 10 min still nothing finally got upset got up and left. The server still had the nerve to ask why i was leaving told her she didnt help us at all and she didnt say a word horrible place wouldn't go back even if they paid me smh..

I ordered Sasa to-go for the first time tonight! I thought they were fabulous! The service was great when I came to pick up my dinner. They even arranged the rolls artistically in my carryout box! I would certainly order from here again!

I have been enjoying sushi for 21 years!  I have to say this is the BEST sushi AYCE, I have ever had. It is an experience, a delectable delight to go here!! Nick and Chris are the best!! They offer unique sushi creations and are so attentive to their customers!!  The fish is so fresh, the employees are so friendly and funny!! I am definitely a regular here after this first time today!!  Thanks SASA SUSHI you rock!!!

I've known this place for a couple of years now. It recently was remodeled under new management and it looks great! My fiancé and myself decided to dine in at the sushi bar and do all you can eat for lunch. Not knowing the new staff  on board i gave it a try. 

Our chef was Nick and let me tell you he is one proud sushi chef! there was not one roll he made that did not impress not only my fiancé but my taste buds as well. We tried rolls we never even herd of and would of probably never even ordered and with out a doubt left us wanting more. There was no need for us to even look at the menu. He knew exactly what to make to keep our taste buds happy. The combinations of not just only his rolls were impeccable but also his other sushi dishes as well. Letting him make and show us his culinary skills was by far the best idea we had that day with out a doubt 

One of the perks that came with all you can eat was the sake! 
The staff was great and welcoming. The place looked nice and comfy with a clean environment.

This is a must visit sushi Bar! One cannot leave with out trying the SASA roll!

Not impressed at all.   Service is extremely slow.   I ordered ramen noodles for my children and my husband and I had All You Can Eat.  The ramen is flavorless and the sushi is tough.  Their rolls had too  much rice in it.   Very disappointed.

Needed a quick lunch in the area, found Sasa. Downloaded the Yelp app for free sake on check in. Wasnt sure what to order, I like cooked rolls but wanted something light. Waiter recommended a baked Mango roll, it was really good. Glad I stopped in. Have a new spot for quick lunch when I'm at the park. YAY

How can this place possibly have so many 5-star ratings?? It should be called So So Sushi, but even that would be too generous. The fish wasn't fresh, the server was boring and the rolls were completely uninspiring. Anytime I see a menu where a lot of the rolls have cream cheese in them, it disappoints me, and that was the case here. We tried this place because it's close to home. We normally go to Sin City Sushi at Eastern and Serene,  but didn't feel like making the drive this time. In the end, we wished we had. Our advice is to stay away from this place. A pretty good local alternative is The Sushi, at Lake Mead and Rampart.

Went there for AYCE dinner last night. Our server seemed a bit grumpy and irritated after asking about some items on the menu, but nevertheless we stayed and ordered. We remembered our first experience being good and the sushi flavor and portions were great. After I got home I started experiencing some stomach pains. My stomach got very upset and I started vomiting. This went on all night to the point I had to call in sick to work. I'm guessing it was the ikura nigiri I had ordered since my bf did not eat it and he was fine. I did not eat or drink anything other than water after we dined there so it was definitely the ikura gone bad. Sad to say we thought we found a decent AYCE sushi place but we will not be returning. Back to Umiya it is.

I've been going here for years all the way back when it was sushi in summerlin. I absolutely loved them but they fell off. The rolls became gross and the staff was just horrible. They've revamped new owner, staff, and chefs. They're AMAZING so happy that I can go to my favorite sushi place again. The chefs are passionate about what they do and will create you rolls based off of things that you like. Special right? I came last week when they were closed by accident and they still allowed me to order my food to go because they happened to have a chef come in early for a private party. Lucky me. Love them wouldn't eat sushi anywhere else. It's fresh and delicious.
I am enjoying myself, have never had Sushi. This is avery nice place. The staff is awesome. Thanks fr a nice birthday dinner.
Came here for the first time today. It is delicious here. The chefs are fast with making your order but personality is not there strong points. I highly recommend Alex's Munchie and the Lisa Lisa.

I was visiting a friend in Vegas and we came to Sasa, this place is amazing!! The all you can eat is a must and so is the onion roll, so delicious!! The fish was fresh and rolls were a good size. I will definitely come back next time I come to visit!!!

It started off well enough and quickly went down hill. 

Customer service was terrible. Once the food was delivered no one ever came by the table to see if we needed anything nor to refill drinks. There being only three tables in the whole restaurant, the other two just waiting on checks.
To top that off, their register broke and it took half an hour for checks to be made.. They even had their owner come  to the restaurant and he only agreed to a discount after a disgruntled table were stuck there due to no check and no explanation..

I've honestly never experienced such poor customer service.. I understand if a register breaks but there are easy ways to appease customers and none of those methods were employed..

Too bad this neighborhood sushi joint lost my local business.

Please read previous reviews about sasa sushi from others bc this place is a total joke. Unfriendly staff and the sushi is terrible. 

Came here and wanted to like this place but everything was bad from the minute me and my family walked in. I will never be back, a lot better sushi joints around.

This is my babes favorite sushi restaurant and I totally understand why!!! He took me here last week for my first time and oh my gossssh, so good!!! I've been thinking about the garlic tuna ever since and can't wait to go back. The chefs behind the bar rock, too!

So I rarely write reviews because I tend to stay in my comfort zone, and yelp probably hates me for it but whatever... 

Sasa is my goto joint. Good quality, excellent service. Nick and the crew have hooked it up since the beginning and have gained a loyal customer. I'm pretty discerning and the quality to value to good time ratio is great. Expect a relaxed atmosphere with chefs that will accommodate you and aren't clock watchers.

I'm happy to have a sushi joint in the neighborhood again.

Sushi was delicious,  waitress was extremely friendly and helpful,  they have a nice calm environment and again,  the sushi was delicious!  If you go here I recommend you try their specialty roll "Call Me Maybe" you will not regret it.
The music selection right now is killing it. Cute is what we aim for, new found glory and mayday parade to go with my beer and good sushi. Yes please.

Where do I begin...  First off let me start off by saying they have the BEST customer service here. We went in last week for a friends birthday and did AYCE and had the best time ever. We would order a few rolls and out would come a chef special and then as the night rolled on they kept bring out new things for us to try!  How awesome for them to go above and beyond to allow us to try things we never would have.  We ended up having a lot left over because of all the extra rolls they brought us but they weren't breathing down our throat or making us pay because we had leftovers.  Sushi was yum!  Can't wait to go back!

Check out my review on yelp 
Friends and I thought we would try a new sushi place near by but that seemed to have been a mistake. Showed up at about 8:45 and by the time we were there, they claimed to have ran out of salmon skin rolls (they only told us after we waited about 15 minutes and asked about it) and different ice cream flavors. When we're paying the price for all you can eat, I would expect to get everything I wanted... especially when the menu doesn't have much to offer compared to all the other all you can eat sushi places. A couple other things too... one of the male waiters seemed a bit rude and we felt rushed when we were putting orders in and our waters were refilled only when we were sucking nothing but drips of water through the straws. We definitely won't be coming back here again. It's worth the drive going to our original sushi spot about 40 minutes away from home.

Delicious, fresh seafood - especially yellowtail. 

Cleanliness meets expectations.

Very friendly, attentive service. We were encouraged to design our own orders.

Will happily return.

By far the best sushi restaurant in Las Vegas!!! I'm here weekly every Sunday whether it be lunch or dinner. I'm their eating some of the best sushi I've ever eaten. The food is phenomenal, but their are some simple things could be improved on.

Better TV programming, I love eating sushi and watching sporting events. You could get a better selection of channels. Especially sports obviously, once that occurs you could get one or two reasonable sized televisions. Considering football season is about to begin that will be a major draw for fans of the game and sushi. Just a suggestion.

Donald and Manny are the best!!!

I've never been to a place soooo willing to feed their customers! Before I was done with one item the waiter was there for my next request. The staff were friendly and inviting, sushi chefs prepared some bada$$ dishes and helped amplify my experience by recommending their finest options. I would highly recommend this sushi joint for anyone who enjoys a good sushi experience. Definitely coming back here my next trip to Vegas!

I love coming to Sasa Sushi for AYCE.  I come every chance I get when I'm in town, about one Saturday a month and sometimes again the very next night for dinner before I get back on the road. They offer half rolls so you can try more of what they have to offer. A few of my favorites are: Mike's Mardi Gras roll, Alex's Munchie roll, the Bank roll, The Tracy Li roll (totally awesome! And the lemon slice gives it just the perfect kick), SSS and Double D. I'll have to take pictures next time. 

I came in with five other people for this visit. The staff is so friendly and quick to get drinks and appetizers or rolls started. We had so much sushi at our table I can't even remember which rolls I was eating.  I totally love my AYCE sushi nights here at Sasa!

Tucked in the corner of a strip mall, the misses and I finally found a worthy Sushi bar on our side of town. Inside was very nice and clean. We both enjoyed the modern appeal of the decor. The misses mentioned that they had remodeled. 
 Now on to the food! The rolls were different than what I've had at other Sushi bars, but to be honest, I enjoyed that. We both ordered the AYCE, which by the way includes 5 pieces of sashimi. Haven't been to a place that includes that with your AYCE! We started out with the Tracy II, which was pretty good. I kind of lost track of the rolls after that point. Oh I did enjoy the texture of the Lisa Lisa. Ended with the Sasa and Alex's Munchie rolls. Both were delicious! 
 The staff were extremely nice and one of the waiters even asked us if this was out first time here. He was very informative about the menu.
 The chefs were also great! I believe it was Nick and I'm guessing Mark. He made a couple of "out of the box" rolls for us. They were both friendly and fun!
 Overall experience was great, and I know we will be back!! Thanks Sasa Suhi!
Introduced my mom to this place and love them even more now! they where so patient with her indecision and the food was amazing as always!

Not sure how this place has 4 stars. My husband and I got food poisoning from this restaurant. We should've went with our first mind because we knew the moment we ordered our nigiri that something was off, the fish was not fresh at all, had a smell and I literally gagged as it went down. Nothing is worse than paying $60 to get sick. The rolls were mediocre and their eel sauce tasted watered down as opposed to its normal thicker substance, which wouldn't be the worse thing if just about every special roll wasn't drenched in the watered down mess. So not only did we not enjoy anything on the menu but the food poisoning was just the icing on the cake. I would've mentioned something to the manager but it was our anniversary so we just wanted to get out of there. We definitely will not be returning.

AYCE joints are usually a 2nd choice for me.......until now!!!  Not only is the food good quality, but the owners and staff make you feel extremely welcome.

Took some friends and their small children to dinner and was told they have a kid's price for AYCE. When our chef, Arnold, saw that the kids really didn't eat that much, the bill was adjusted to a much lower price.......a gesture that will not be forgotten.

My wife has unique dietary needs, they were more then happy to leave out sauces and ingredients that she's sensitive to which i'm sure is a total PITA.

Can't stress enough that I think the fish is on par with a good non-AYCE place. Drinks are never empty and dishes were cleared quickly.

Since nothing is perfect, I will comment that after the change in owners and the remodel, one prominent wall was left mostly a plain white; in dire need of some beautiful themed paintings...........like maybe some Christian Lassen works.  

(the last paragraph is an inside joke between the owner, Chris, and I........the truth is there's really nothing I can think of that would have made my dinner any more enjoyable)

My husband and I love sushi!! We don't do the rolls at all, we only eat nigiri. This place was awesome!! Manning I think his name was great, him and his staff we're very friend. Everything was fresh and he also brought some other sushi we haven't ate before. We will most definitely go back there again, and every time after that!!

I am in the f&b business and let's start with the service. So bad. Server not even nice. Felt like mad every time I ordered something. No thank you.. I would be polite and thank for every dish drop I would just get ignored. Service might get through some of the negatives of the quality of sushi but sushi chef seemed not to care(u serve raw fish!) so disappointed I spent my hard earned dollar here. Attached pictures of dirty dishes on my table the whole meal. I never complain but it was just above and beyond a HORRIble!! Experience. I have met owner and I feel bad staff is representing them in this way... If ther is any doubt I will attach pictures of what we got served here... Dis colored fish...mushy urchin.and in this town of word of mouth me working in restaurants summerlin area this I will make sure no one ever waste a dollar in this place. Like I said I have met the owners and super nice people if u would like to email me about my experience pls do...place was like a ghost town. Now I know why.
Surprised at the quality lunch. Chefs attention to getting it right and service was good. I recommend this place for their high standards.

Went with my family to eat sushi. Waiter was brain dead. He took our order and returned with three food items no one at our table ordered. He failed after several requests to bring us tea to drink or containers to place soy sauce in. Asked for an order of yakatori with no sauce. I told the waiter three times please no sauce on the yaks tori. The waiter returned with yakatori drenched in sauce. We ordered all you can eat. The waiter disappeared for long periods of time so we could not place our order for additional sushi. The service was very poor. I would not subject my family to this poor dining experience again.

My visit this time was 10x better. I knew there was a reason why I keep coming back. 

The last visit, understandably it was busy due to valentines yet I expected service to be a bit quicker. 

Tonight, no complaints!  I am a satisfied customer. We'll continue our monthly visits here as long as they continue the good service. :)
Always  fresh. , always  great setvice. " Check in" for a free saki. Manny and Donald  doing a stupendous job .Plying  us with specials. Try the popcorn scallops .

I loved the service, the guy attending us was awesome and got us the food quick (we were seated at the bar), i tried the gyoza, fried scallops, fireball, caterpillar, mardi gras, sc 7, japanese lasagna, shrimp and yellowtail nigiri, and the red bean ice cream. I was however sad because one, i'm used to have having nearly 2 full pages of sushi options, and this time i had about 6/7 of one page. Not to mention nearly everything was a bit too sweet for my tastes and the spicy options werent exactly bursting with flavor. Not to mention the red bean ice cream which is my favourite ice cream wasn't all that great. Aside from that though the sushi was pretty good, it tasted fresh and was good quality. So even though i personally didn't care too much for it, I would say its a decent place with good food.
Like a sombodi its so good. Best las Vegas ayce sushi place. Fast and good quality food, highly recommended and I'm Asian I should know.

I am Japanese-Korean so Sushi is my favorite food that I eat almost every week. We have a couple of regular places to go eat AYCE sushi but my husband and I wanted to try a new place in our side of town. Their service was okay but their AYCE menu is very limited compared to other AYCE restaurants. We mostly eat Nigiri sushi, not rolls, so my review is on Nigiri sushi. My husband and I were very disappointed, their sushi seemed not authentic and fish is pretty thick and very dull/plain taste. Their rolls might be good since I didn't order them but if you want to eat Nigiri, I don't recommend.

Walked into Sasa Sushi tonight around 530. Saw that the place was clean, and neat. Our servers lacked personality all around. Seemed like they were just ready to have the night be over with.

Our mussels took 30 minutes. Had to ask for refills on Sake and beer 3 times. I was LESS than impressed with the dynamite and eel sauce. The only good roll I had was the Munchie roll, and that even needed a lot of soy sauce. Won't be going back. $74 dinner and not satisfied or moved by the urgency of the staff.

I'll stick with The Strip or LA for sushi from now on.

This is my absolute favorite sushi spot in Vegas. My boyfriend & I try to make it down here once a week & we've been patrons for more than a year now. Manny & Donald are great! They know exactly what we like & don't like & most of the time, will have already prepared our orders before we tell them what we want. They are fantastic! If anyone ever asks me for a recommendation, I ALWAYS refer them here. 

The only reason I am not giving Sasa a full 5-star review is because of the wait staff (especially Erin in particular). In the year & a half we have been dining here, I have never once seen him smile. He walks up to customers with a very sour expression & a clear vibe of disinterest. He never comes to refill you drinks, unless you flag him down (I have actually walked my cup up to him before & asked for a refill), he never remembers to bring us lemons for our water, he slides/slams our plates down in front of us, never says excuse me, & constantly complains about everything. My boyfriend & I have said to the other staff, more than once, "if he is so unhappy, why hasn't he just quit already?!"

Other than his bad attitude, this place is the best. You can't beat the AYCE prices, the atmosphere & the delicious fish! My love for this place is far greater than my hatred for the poor server.

My gf and I went for spontaneous dinner with no expectations at all on our last night in Vegas on our road trip. The first impression of the place was meh but as we entered we felt the coolness of the place.
The food was cheap, delicious and filling and the service was sharp and gracious. 
Definitely recommended!

Long wait to be seated, lack of service, long waits for food, no drinks, had to serve ourselves items we needed so we could eat food once we got it, unprofessional, and openly rude.

We stood in the door waiting to be seated for over 10 minutes even though only 2 tables in the whole place had people to serve, and there was 8 staff not assisting us (2 at sushi bar, 6 chatting together ignoring their jobs).  I ordered and so did my kids.  Despite asking for chopsticks, a fork, water, and napkins at least 6 times in 30 mins & not being able to eat this whole time because we didn't have stuff to eat the food with (we had cooked food, soup, and sushi) or drinks, we got most of it ourselves because they openly and rudely ignored us and attempts to get their attention.  When we did get the waters we were constantly out of water to drink (cup was 90% ice and had little water to begin with when they brought to us), we sipped ice cubes for relief because despite the fact there was more than enough staff, they were too busy chatting about their personal life issues.  They actually looked at us, then ignored our arms in the air trying to wave them over or even when we got up and asked for service!  The soup was good but is was mostly liquid and not much content in it so not filling at all, the meat was overcooked to almost beyond eating (think dried jerky meat), and the sushi was good quality cut meat but warm.  At the end of the meal a nice man joined us from returning from his break and relieved who we had.  He more than tried to make up for things, but by then (after an 1.5hrs) after all that we already knew we were not coming back.  We tipped well, but only on the condition that he get all of it and it not be shared with the others that were there.  It also took so long in between our food items that we ordered arriving that we did not even get it all in that 1.5 hrs and we ordered within 5 mins of sitting down because we already knew what we wanted when we got there.  Because of this, we left hungry and had to get drive thru!  OMG. 

 Unless you like being ignored, not getting your food or service, and have hour to kill while you pay someone for this, don't bother with this place.  

There are so many places that want business that they value their customers enough to serve them when they try to give them business.

We went back yesterday for lunch and things were back to normal.  The server was so attentive, nice and got all of our orders right.  I asked her what was included in our AYCE lunch menu since their menu wasn't up to date and she updated me on what was available for lunch up front which made me realize that the last time it was our fault for not asking and their fault for not updating!  This was our 10th time and remained a great experience.

My husband and I have been coming here two years and every time it I amazing. Even when it's busy their waiters make sure to take care of you. The sushi chiefs and waiters are always friendly! Some of the best sushi we have ever had. We brought a group of friends here and even with 8 of us we were served in a timely manor. Their customer services is the best in town. Even the manager is on the floor when it's busy making sure everyone is taken care of! Ask them to make you a random roll! They are always good. We will be coming here as long as you are open. Keep making great sushi and bringing good vibes to all.

Just moved into the neighborhood and we were looking for a new place to come for sushi. First time here and definitely will be back! Sushi is fresh and the service was awesome. Love that they have an all you can drink along with AYCE. :)
Great rolls and service, always so fast and delicious. The staff is super friendly, and the sushi chefs are really funny.

There is no denying the sushi was delicious and the prices weren't bad. I only gave three stars due to the waitress, she looked like we were inconveniencing her by even walking in, she wasn't friendly at all. She took mine and my hubbies drink order and walked away without asking what our toddler wanted... Then had an attitude when I asked for a drink for him. She took a while to take our order then dropped it off, never to return. Thankfully a gentleman waiter came and took our second order, and then another waitress refilled my hubbies drink (mine was never refilled). Then we asked for boxed she brought two but 15 min later I had to ask for the check. I put my card in the check holder and she walked by 3 times and just stared at it (she walked by us a lot without even acknowledging us) I had to send my hubby and toddler to the car because my two year old was becoming inpatient.  to the waitress I feel she needs a new job.
We had dinner at Sasa Sushi last night to celebrate my husband's birthday. The sushi was great and the customer service was awesome. Will definitely be back.
Great small place, good service. Group of 4 doing the AYCE...Best with Reservations otherwise the wait time is long.
This place is awesome!!!! The guys made us feel at home this is def our new sushi place!!! Yoshi, Nick and Donald thanx for making our 1st time many more to come

When I moved here from california,  I set out to find a great sushi place close to my house. I went to a few that were alright. Sasa is the bomb! Chef Nick and his crew do it right! From specialty rolls off the cuff, to menu items and the weekly fish specials, Sasa is a force to be reckoned with. I highly recommend this place, you will no regret it!

This place is an AMAZING place to have rolls...half or full and all you can eat options...giving you a chance to try more varieties of Sushi!!! I've tried Sushi before and never liked it until I tried Sasa Sushi for my ultimate determination if I would call it quits. As the result...I CRAVE SUSHI THANKS TO SASA SUSHI! Great Service, Great Sushi, and Great Times

My girlfriend and I have come in here a lot lately but never again. Bugs. Bugs were crawling out from under the fish case at the bar. Never have I been so disgusted in my life. To add insult they offer us a "discount" of 10%. And even worse a table of 9 and a table of 4 just walked in. They continue to use food out of that cooler and serve it to people. Disgusting. Awful. Degrading.

To top it off as were leaving the waitress told us, and I quote, "this doesn't happen very often."

These guys are true artist ,not only with the aesthetics but with the flavors. Everything tastes fabulously delicious! The chefs make you feel like family.  I wish I could take them back to California with me. Definitely coming back.

AWESOME!!! My family wanted to try a new sushi place and the reviews looked great. I informed the waiter that it was our 1st time and we were going to have AYCE. After taking our order, not only was the food delivered QUICKLY, but the waiter also kept sending us items to sample and they were all AMAZING. Don't forget to check in and get your free sake! Very pleased with the service and the food and left EXTREMELY full and satisfied!!! We will definitely be returning!!

Love this place!!! Nick, Kevin, Manny, Donald, Tyler and Erin are fantastic! Always a good time at Sasa's!!!  Food is on point! If you don't know what to order just tell them what you like and you will be forever hooked! Love it! Owners are very nice also!  Why go to big sushi places when you can go local and get some yummy fresh fish and great service!

One of my favorite spots for sushi. The prices are good, the service is on point, and my whole family enjoys the experience every time. Dad gets sake and a couple rolls, mom enjoys a bento box, and our little girl can't get enough tempura. A great place to get great sushi.
Love it - a great time every time. Food is great and so is the staff. Our favorite sushi in vegas.
Omg this is so great an love the pokie the Service was great the sushi chef were great found a new spot on my side of town

1 Star is even to high a rating!!!! We have eaten here in the past about once a week.  We stopped about 3-4 months ago...service and food went downhill.  Last night we thought we would give it another try.  We are really sorry we did.  We did AYCE but, when you waitress never comes back it is hard to order anything but the first small order we started with.  We ordered 1 salmon skin hand roll and the salmon was so hard, dark brown in color, you could not even bite it.  We sent it back when we were delivered our check by a different waitress.  The owner, a lady came in and left when we were there.  We will not go back and the rest of our family has found another Sushi restaurant.  Oh yes, they had signs plastered all over the door that they only take CASH.

Read the recent bad reviews and decided to come in on lunch break anyway. SO GLAD I DID.  This place was awesome. Low-key and with super cool sushi chefs. I didn't see the snotty hostess that so many people seem to not care for. I'll definitely be back for many lunch breaks to come.

We stopped eating here years ago when the management changed.  Our favorite sushi place closed not long ago, so we decided to try Sasa Sushi again.  The food is great, the service is fast, and the staff is friendly.  My wife and daughter are on a limited diet due to food allergies.  They are very accommodating to their allergies.  My Daughter is only one year old, and they go out of their way to make sure they prepare food that she can eat.  We have been to Sasa twice in the last two months, and the service has been awesome both time.  For an AYCE sushi, this is a great place to eat.

This was the first time I ever ate here.  It was the most delicious sushi I have had in a while.  The staff is wonderful.  They kept making us different dishes to try.  I had the ayce.  Worth every penny.  Definitely going back soon.
Best salmon skin roll everrrrrrrr. Seriously love this place, and they have the best salmon I have ever had, seriously buttery! When you want BOMB sushi and awesome service...come here!
Absolutely love this place! Great sushi, great staff, and more then anything I love their Mochi balls :))

The wife and I ate the AYCE lunch for the first time today.  The atmosphere was great, not crowded, no blaring music, clean and very friendly staff.  Had the pleasure of Nick as the sushi chef and Joe as our server.  Both were courteous, friendly, and efficient with our orders.  All food was very good.  Had poke salad, nigiri, and for our first visit Nick made most orders a half roll so we could try many items.  Everything was very tasty.  Only thing I did not like was that some of the rolls that were torched were tasty, but had a little fuel after taste, and as some other reviewers have mentioned, the nigiri was microscopic in size.  I have only come across one other sushi joint that served this way.  The salmon belly was very tasty, but four pieces were only equal to one regular order that you would receive elsewhere.  Other than those minor issues we would definitely go back again.  

Nick also surprised us a couple times with items we did not order.  He made an off menu item called the 10K, and another one called The Black Widow.  Both very tasty.  Will give a second try later and see how it goes.  A tad on the high side price wise compared to other sushi places along this Cheyenne Ave. corridor.  $21.95 lunch, $25.95 dinner, both AYCE.  

Great job Nick and Joe.

I normally steer away from All you can eat places because in the past I have found the quality of the fish questionable and it being mostly rice. 

This place completely changed that for me. This is the only all you can eat place I will go.  I can't actually eat that much so I always get one of the rolls but my daughter loves the yellow tail, red snapper and salmon sashimi here. The edamame is wonderfully hot and seasoned and the chefs are fun to talk to. My only complaint is one waiter who could use a happy pill but even he is kind of funny once you get used to him. Great place, great food and I am so happy I tried it!  It's now a regular spot for my family.

I'm gonna be completely honest....when I first began coming to this place I would have given it a easy 4 star rating because the selection is awesome and the sushi "was" pretty tasty, but I think now that I was mostly just impressed by the fact that they had uni and sweet shrimp as an option with the All You Can Eat option that's cool even though you can only get 2 orders per person :-(...but as I continued to go the sushi got worse and worse each time, specifically, the sushi felt rushed and the temperature was definitely off!
Service....uhmmm....now bottom line and hands down they have specifically 1 of the most WORST waiters of all time! He's rude, he's a know it all, he ignores you, he's cocky and arrogant and No one seems to enjoy having him around(NOT EVEN THE STAFF)I'm surprised that he's still there and I've been going there for just about a year now! 
Needless to say that I will not return with my friends or family not because they have the worst food but because it's not very good and I find it hard to enjoy a meal when you're not happy with the food and the server!

Party of 4 for Ayce sushi on a Saturday night. The sushi was good, but not great... We have high sushi standards. We felt "eh"  about most of the rolls. The service was great and earned them 4 stars instead of 3. Read some previous reviews about "fishy" or "slimy" food, we didn't have that experience and we ordered uni, mussels, and the sweet shrimp. Overall it wasn't bad, it just didn't wow us. We probably won't be back personally.

This was the first time we ate there since it was Sushi Summerlin. The nigari was small not saying that it Wa bad just small pieces and the rolls seems like that as well. The overall flavor was not the same and the rice was hard. The sushi chef was super friendly and was very attentive when you wanted something I just feel the overall flavor and quality was average at best.
Servers here definitely are not into their jobs... sushi was so so. Ambience leaves much to be desired. I won't eat here again.

great little sushi spot! came for a late dinner with the family and unfortunately the rice turned out pretty dry. nonetheless, I've been here during better hours and it was always awesome! definitely worth trying out! peas!

I love this place so much!!! All the sushi chefs are friendly will gladly make a roll special roll just for you tailored to your taste the staff is very friendly even the owners are nice and don't mind rolling up there sleeves and help serve you and the food is great only wish they had a few more hot appetizers

I just picked up sushi to go and it was about on par with what you get at the supermarket. The eel was chewy, the rice over cooked or old, scallops were poor quality and even my cat wouldn't eat the salmon nigiri. I don't like to give a bad review but when you pay 25 for two rolls and nigiri, it should be better.

Amazing place. I loved every roll i ate. Great service, as this was the first time being here....he asked what things we liked and didnt like and brought us things he thought we would like to try...we got the all you can eat. This place makes me like sushi more!

I'm always up for trying new places, and this place did not disappoint! You get so much for what you're paying for. Everything is so fresh and delicious. I ordered the Sasa dinner combo and it came with an entire California roll, tempura shrimp and veggies, miso soup, salad, rice, a side of rice, teriyaki chicken and wontons. Can't wait to go back.

Eh just ok. Service wasn't great and food was mediocre.  Everything seemed to be drenched in mayo.  One good thing was they had brown rice but I did have to call in advance to let them know because they said it would take 30 minutes to prepare.  All that and the waiter still brought out my first roll with white rice and looked at me like I was crazy when I politely pointed out their mistake.  I may be a pain in the butt when it comes to being a little picky with my order but I don't mind paying for it and tipping well... so what's the deal with the poopy face, Mr. Waiter? Lol

Sushi in Summerlin is now SaSa sushi. My mother and I have been coming to this location for 11 years now. We were very pleased to know that they kept some of the old menu along with one of the old chefs.  With the newly improved decor and the friendly service, we have made this our weekly outing spot. Being so convenient and closer to the house, I no longer have the need to drive to spring mountain or Goyemon sushi. The food was great, delicious and satisfying!

Place was empty on a wednesday at 2pm. got the AYCE everything was pretty yummy no complaints, just not best service and music was SO ANNOYING. Also the fans were making lights flicker, another annoyance. But sushi was yummy

The last time I reviewed this restaurant I gave them 5 Stars. This time ... had a hard time justifying 2 Stars. Very disappointed in both the service and the quality of the food. My husband and I always sit at the bar so we can socialize with the sushi chef and have him create whatever he likes for us. This trip we had a hard time getting this chef to even get our requested selections right. The fish was not fresh. Hard to eat tuna when it's brown instead of red. Even my favorite poke salad was sub-par. Looks like I need a new favorite sushi restaurant. This is getting hard since they all start off really impressive then slowly go downhill. Does anyone express personal pride in their product anymore ??? Sad ;-(
Small place but worth every bite. Great service and friendly staff. Can't wait to visit again

Found our new sushi spot!!! I used to go to this place many years ago and loved it but it had different owners. We were searching for a sushi spot close to home and this place came up!   It was DE-lish!!  It's our new favorite sushi spot close to home. We usually have to travel to the south side of town for some good Sushi! The service was just as great!  They have colorful plastic spoons and bowls for kids!  Kids under 5 are free!  The quality of the sushi is amazing.  Order the salmon belly!  And carpaccio! And garlic tuna! And pork belly. YUM!

All you can eat Sushi.
Fresh and clean materials.
Nice and clean place.
I do love ice cream mochi.

Fresh fish masterfully created into plates of nigiri, rolls and sashimi. Extensive menu for ayce and a very knowledgable staff. Sasa has a great atmosphere, is beautiful in decor and comfortable for singles, groups and families. They're special not only for their food but for the caring of the ownership and chefs. I've been here 6 times in the year they've been operating and every time was special and we've always enjoyed ourselves.
My favorite sushi spot! The chefs here know what they are doing and service is generally quick and polite.

I'm not a big fan about trying new sushi spots but this one catch my attention. It's small cute and close to home so why not? Well it was worth it. The food was great and the service was better! They were fast and friendly! I definitely recommend it!

If cream cheese and a spicy mix of old slimy fish is their version of sushi,  then I'm never eating here again.  All the pieces of nigiri were smelly slimy or flavorless and plastic like.  Soggy gross, the rice was not sushi grade. 

I switched to rolls,  thinking maybe that's what they do right.  Nope,  every roll was a rice ball stuffed with a spicy version of every fish or cream cheese.  

The chef never looked at us,  no eye contact,  we had to put our hands up to get his attention,  and we were sitting at the bar in front of him. 

Save your self a bad belly,  and go elsewhere.
Excellent sushi.  I had a custom 99 (whatever that means), and it was great.  See attached pic.

This place has become my favorite place to go for sushi. $25 all you can eat sushi. You can sit at the bar and have all kinds of delicious rolls made. I like that you can get half rolls so you have room to try more of a variety.

This place is amazing. My wife and I have been looking for a sushi spot close to the house and boom! This place is bomb! Fish was fresh and rice to fish ratio was great. They even gave my kids there own colorful bowl to eat out of. The salmon belly was one of the best I ever had. Salmon skin roll was bomb and a must try. Kid friendly and just a great place to have dinner. I would definitely come back over and over again. Staff was professional and courteous. They even had a cool outside area to wait, plenty of space for your kids to run around without any worry of cars hitting them.
This place is great. Ayce  is good value. Try the "playboy" and "bank" rolls. 2 other greats: salmon skin handroll, firecracker.
Great place, friendly and funny cooks. Everyone is polite and service is fast. We will definitely be coming back here from now on.

For ayce sushi, it's one of the best for sure.  I just found it, and I would give it 5 stars, but in both of my two trips here, they seamed understaffed, so things took a bit longer than I would have hoped.  The portions were all very good.  Our chef made us some custom dishes, and was very helpful based on the early items we liked.  They always have yellowtail collar too.  If their service gets a bit quicker, I will bump them up to 5 star for sure.  I will be back nonetheless.
Best AYCES around the North West side of Vegas!!! Manny is my chef!!!! When I go!!! Very well plated and delicious!  Quick too! Love this place!!! The atmosphere is great as well as the wait staff!
We've been here a few times. Love this AYCE sushi spot. They also have my favorite iced green tea and no limit on dessert! Will definitely be going back

Firstly, for AYCE devotees, please know that, for the time being, they are offering a sashimi appetizer.

Secondly, for those who happen to have something of a small appetite, but, do enjoy the opportunity to sample (as do I), please know they do offer half rolls.

You do have to be looking for this place as it is tucked behind a line of buildings.  Once found, however, *it is a great find.*  I was so pleased to still be accommodated for all you can eat at 10pm (in a local neighborhood).  The interior is simple and clean, the staff was warm and inviting.  The music is contemporary, but, kept a level condusive for conversation, allowing for a nice, sophisticated vibe.  The server was knowledgeable, explained all the essentials from the onset, and, stayed posted at the front of the restaurant facing guests.  I happened in to this place on a night where I was dining by myself, and, and, felt not one bit out of place as there were several other women also dining solo, and, none of us were distracted from our meals in any way. 

I ordered a series of items, the sushi chefs were quick, and, personable.  My choices included the poke, the salmon handroll, and, the house specialty (half) roll.  All of my dishes tasted so light and well prepared - with no heavy sauces or mayonnaise.  I truly wish I was capable of eating more - as the chefs continued to encourage.  I felt I'd had a most satisfying meal, and, left with a re-exhuberation of all you can eat.  I was completely satisfied, and, not in want of anything.
 
I used to come here often with the prior ownership, but, am so happy to have rediscovered it!  For anyone looking to for all you can eat in this area, I totally recommend!

We do ayce sushi often and Sasa Sushi is top pick. The fish is fresh, service is great and atmosphere is inviting.

This is our new spot, for sure.

Thank you, Sasa Sushi!

I went for lunch after a stressful day, but unfortunately before work so I wasn't able to try the saki the chef had recommended I try since it was my first time there.

The waiter was attentive and the chefs made me feel welcome at the bar. I had to visit alone since my wife is allergic to fish, but unlike many other places I've tried in the past SaSa Sushi made me feel welcome and comfortable to be there solo.

On the way out I thanked everyone and the chef said see you tomorrow. I wish, but I will be back very soon.

* Reasonable prices.
* Very clean and modern.
* Extremely good food.
* Plethora of choices.
* Welcoming environment.

Food is good. Not the best but your average ayce sushi in Vegas. Nothin spectacular. But the server was literally the worst I have had in any restaurant in all of Vegas. I don't think he smiled once. Everything was monotone he never asked how things were. It was to the point that we felt so awkward that we left early just to get out of there. It felt like we were bothering him by being there. It wasn't busy at all he had at most 2 tables. It was an off time and he didn't welcome us at all. I would go if in the area if the service was better

Came here for lunch to see sushi chef Manny, an old friend from Hawaii.  Unfortunately he was off, but we decided to stay for the ayce lunch anyway as this was our first time here and we wanted to try a new sushi place.

Upon entering, an employee in regular street clothes was standing behind the sushi counter.  It took literally 30 seconds of myself and my wife standing there at the entrance before he even acknowledged us.  No hostess was present or seen at this time.

Upon being seated, this same employee came to get our drink order and asked if we wanted to order anything from the kitchen.  The hostess finally came out after almost 10 minutes and took our sushi order.  

Very sub par food.  Rice for our nigiri sushi was smaller in size but was cold and chewy, as in just came out of the refrigerator cold.  Maybe trying to use up some old rice that was left over?  Salmon and tuna was just "ok", quality not up to par with other ayce sushi places.  Against our better judgement we ordered 1 more order of tuna nigiri.  Rice was better but not really.  We mostly got filled on appetizers, of which the selection is very small.

Needless to say we will not be back nor can I recommend this place.  Service is severely lacking, along with serving cold and chewy sushi rice.  We had high hopes for this place, especially since our friend Manny had such good reviews.  He wasn't here today, but I don't think even he can convince us to try this place again.

food decent cant cut it down, average or above .... guy behind counter buff looking guy, don't know if he is the owner or just an employee... no hello no goodbye, no thank nothing----- absolutely hateful mean person, wont make eye contact with you purposely knowing you want something or to speak to him even if you try to be nice despicable demeanor and enough to keep me from ever considering returning...

My first visit to Sasa was a great experience! The staff, right off the bat, was super friendly and joked around with their customers. I was kinda anxious about their AYCE rules with 1 hr and 15 min time limit for dinner! Haha! Not that I plan on "camping in". I can't eat as fast I want to! No one wants to choke while eating their meal! 

Appetizers: 5/5
Poke salad was garnished with some seaweed. It was fresh and delicious with just the right amount of dressing in it. Other locations dredge their poke salad with the sauce and that's one of my pet peeves. 
Tuna carpaccio was super yummy! Love the mild sweet sauce with a kinda garlicky taste to it served with mayo underneath.
Amaebi was one of the best I've had! Love the lightly breaded flavorful shrimp heads! 

Nigiri: 3.5/5
Salmon belly, eel, and tuna were really fresh, but my first few pieces of the nigiri, sushi rice was a little bit undercooked. Rice to fish ratio was awesome! Perfectly sliced thickness with VERY small amount of rice! We will see IF the second visit will be the same ratio.

Sushi Rolls: 4/5
The only sushi roll I ordered from the menu was the Sasa. It has shrimp tempura, spicy crab, cream cheese, avocado, and salmon. The sauces were mayo, sriracha, and eel sauce. I really like it a lot, but it could have been better if the shrimp tempura had some crunch to it. The rest of the special rolls I've had were made by Nick who was superb! I was game for anything he can create! And oh boy did he impress me! 

Small cut of sashimi served in the traditional Asian soup spoon with a sweet hint of sauce was delicious! This creation was repeated, but this time it was served on fried crunchy edible leaves. The next roll he whipped up was a tuna roll with tuna, crab, and scallops. It was garnished with super creamy sauce and jalepeno for added heat.

Deserts: 3.5/5
Yuzu sorbet! It's about time someone gave me a full scoop of this goodness! Most places either give you about a tablespoon or it looks like a full scoop, but it's hollow inside. Really? You think I can't tell the difference?!? LMAO! 
Green tea tempura ice cream was just "okay". Green tea was weak in flavor and not as creamy as other green tea ice cream I've had.

I would definitely come back since I barely tried out their menu selections, but I would probably not come here with a large group since there is a time limit of 75 minutes. BTW, they have happy hour with 20% off their a la carte sushi rolls from 2pm-5pm.

Reliable but nothing special.  And by reliable I mean mediocre fish covered in tons of sauce.  U know: American style Japanese food cooked by Mexicans. 

:-)

Upon entering the restaurant you're quickly greeted as the sushi bar faces the entrance. It's not a big place but there is a mixture of table sizes perfect for both big groups and smaller parties. 

There is a decent sized selection of sushi. We decided to try the All You Can Eat Sushi AYCE. It was 25 dollars. 

They have specific rules as to what you can and cannot due when ordering all you can eat. You can only stay for 1hr 15minutes when choosing AYCE. 

We had the volcano roll, fireball, bank and Alex's munchie. They were very delicious. Of course they were on the specialty style sushi. 
They make the sushi pretty fast. Its smart to just sit at the bar if you're doing all you can eat sushi. 

The server was pretty attentive. She came around to refill our drinks. The sushi artists weren't very engaging, they just kept to themselves So not much interaction if youre gonna eat alone. 

Speciality sushis were around 11 to 14 dollars. You'd get your moneys worth with AYCE if you just order 3! 

 Overall the sushi was very good and I would definitely come back to try the other rolls.

Whenever my boyfriend and I decide we wanna eat out, he doesn't even have to ask me where I wanna go because it's always SASA SUSHIII!! Lol I work at an AYCE restaurant but this place is my shit..the servers aren't always the best, I'm ALWAYS satisfied with the sushi chefs, always sending us things they know I want even before ordering it and making panda oranges for my baby, but server wise im pretty much only always happy when the short Asian girl serves us. I forget her name, but she's always on it and always checks on us, busy or not. The other servers kinda always seem like there in a rush even when it's not busy, forgets a lot of things we order. Since I work in an AYCE restaurant I know how it is so for the most part it's not a big deal, but when were only one out of 3 parties there i just feel service should be a little better. Besides the service sometimes I still give this place 5 stars because I just love the food so much!! Didn't even go there today, was just craving it so decided to look at pictures on yelp. Lol but yeah MY FAVE SUSHI PLACE!!!

The sushi here is very fresh! I got the Mexican roll and it was delicious. My husband ordered the gioza and it was flavorful and crispy. My dad ordered the unagi sushi and he said it was good too. My reason for three stars is because all three of us ordered the katsudon pork bowls and the rice was not cooked. It was completely crunchy. Which ruins the entire dish. The staff apologized and brought out a small bowl of fresh rice which was still crunchy but better than the original batch. We were the only ones in the restaurant so maybe they were in a rush? The katsudon was ok. The ones I've had before had the rice soaked in whatever sauce they use. This one was dry and only on the pork. Overall, I would only come back for the sushi. So if you're in the mood for sushi this is your place.

This place is really good, it's currently my go-to sushi spot. The hostess seems to have a 'I don't care' attitude at first but was attentive and got our orders in right away. She recommended a couple of rolls and brought us few special rolls.

We came here after reading so many great reviews. We came here right at opening on a Thursday. The waiter mumbled at us at the door and said go ahead and pointed to the booth. He seemed very bored/dry and uninterested. He acted like that with the other patrons so we didn't take it personally. The sushi chefs were personable to the customers sitting at the counter. We ordered apps, several rolls, nigiri, and hand rolls. Everything came out quickly. Good ratio of fish and rice. Overall we had a few items that were impressive, but most were average and didn't stand out. My husband and I loved the salmon skin and soft shell crab hand rolls. The kids liked the agadashi tofu and calamari. The poke salad was delicious. The super white nigiri was typical to other places. The pain in the ass roll was not as good as it sounded in the menu. They allowed us to order spicy tuna on crispy rice, which wasn't on the menu, that was nice, but the rice part wasn't as good as other locations. The Sasa roll was decent. Overall, the food came out quickly, but I wasn't all that impressed with the rolls and the limited appetizer menu especially with all the great reviews. It's good for a quick lunch, but didn't leave a strong impression.

The sushi was super fresh and great tasting. Service was awesome as usual. This place has a super great value for all that you get. Happy hour specials like crazy. Will continue to come here in the future.

Just wanna update and say we love our sever Aaron he's the best!! Always on top of everything give this man a raise!! And out favorite sushi chefs Kevin & Nick!!! The three of them alone make this place awesome..lol and the sushi is good too

I hate to give this place 3 stars HOWEVER we went there yesterday for MY birthday and needless to say the waiter had horrible customer service. He was super bland and had an attitude the whole evening.  Of course since we ordered AYCE we wanted to try different rolls through out the night. Everytime we asked for a new roll he kind of rolled his eyes. Also with check in I should of got a house sake BUT that never came. Thanks buddy.

THE FOOD was BOMB.COM!!!!!!! Very fresh salmon nigiri. We would of ordered every piece of salmon in the place if we didn't want to try other items. If the waiter matched the food this place definitely would of had another star.

Would I eat it again? Definitely :)
Just hope I don't get that guy again ugh.
Love this place seriously yum! Sushi is super fresh and customer service is great also you get a free sale when you check in which is great! Also they have all day all you can eat!

This place is great if you're looking for an extremely heap ayce for lunch or dinner. Service is fast, food quality is okay in terms of sushi. Not the best but also you're paying less than most places. Love the music played in here all the 2000 hits and boy bands everyone can recognize.
THE *BEST* sushi restaurant I've been too in Vegas!! Everyone is SO nice, food is AMAZING!! So fresh and delicious!!  My new favorite sushi spot!! I highly recommend going!!!

well, I used to frequent this place often when it was Sushi in Summerlin.  It apparently has a different manager, same owner (or reverse) and same chef.  Similar menu with the addition of some new rolls and a couple deletions...of course one of the biggest disappointment--the Todd Roll has been removed.  It was not only my fave, but I used to hear others order it as well.  I'm sure they would make it if you asked.  Service was a little faster than before (that was one of the problems--slow service), but could've been a little more friendly.   I'm sure they are getting tired of people walking in and not knowing what to expect and answering questions.  The interior looks really nice--exterior is the same, but it's in a strip mall.  I got one order of nigiri, ok.  And a couple rolls.  One prob still w/their rolls--pieces are cut huge and a LOT of rice.  Taste was pretty good.  I might go back, but as others have posted, there are sooo many sushi places to choose from....we'll see.
Still has the best AYCE sushi in the area in my opinion. Staff is friendly, food is proportioned generously, good prices on drinks and they have never dissapointed!

Another fabulous visit. This is by far the best service and AYCE sushi in town. I come in regularly and don't even need to order. The food just starts coming. They love to make new creations and each bite is more flavorful and beautiful than the next. The chefs here are truly talented.

Good AYCE in North Vegas / Summerlin area. The usual price of 26$ for dinner. Surprised and happy with their signature roll options. The Sasa roll was good and spicy, Orange Tiger was different and flavorful, Pain in the Ass roll is deep fried and spice with wasabi mayo. 
Usual dessert options of mocha and green tea ice cream. 

Ask them to make you something out of an orange!
Really yummy spot my favorite rolls were Japanese Lasagne and Sams Volcano the spot is very clean and the staff very nice I would definitely return here.

This place is amazing.. especially the sushi chef, Nechar. He is very helpful and accommodating. Great quality of food and the staff is extremely friendly. I've been to many sushi spots and this definitely hits my top 1 favorite spot. Off the vegas strip but definitely worth it. Worth every price.. I'm stuffed and happy!!

This is my favorite all you can eat sushi restaurant. The fish is so fresh. Love the nigiri and their hand rolls. The tuna carpaccio and the pork belly is a must. I like that they don't load everything down with sauce. I have several AYCE sushi restaurants by my house but I will make the drive to Sasa anytime.

I'm writing this review because I feel like this place has a few small problems that if were fixed would turn it into a top tier sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. 

We showed up at 6 pm on a Friday night. About a 15 minute wait. No problem, it's a small place. We were seated and given menus and we placed orders but didn't receive our first roll until nearly 30 minutes after we ordered. 

I believe the reason for this is the place was just slammed. They got unlucky and a whole bunch of people showed up at once and the orders poured in. Nobody left for the first half and hour we were there. They've got to streamline their back of house to take care of this situation. The food was trickling out of the bar when there were four guys back there. 

The servers did a great job of making sure everyone was as happy as possible but there is only but so much servers can do when there is no food. On top of it more than a few tables got rolls they didn't order, I myself got a double order when I clearly placed one order. This kind of stuff just snowballs inefficiency and really adds up. Some of the rolls were very tasty. My favorite was the mango crunch. It was fresh and new and different. On the other hand other rolls were very lazily made. One of my rolls wasn't sealed and fell apart every time I picked up a piece. Another roll was sloppy and clunky and made eating a mouthful at a time impossible. 

The food was good though. The nigiri was fresh and the portions of fish were generous. The free house sake with check in was great. 

At times some of the servers seemed a bit unprofessional and were scratching and moving in odd ways. Nothing devious of nasty, just not the demeanor a pro server should have. 

Overall If this place tightened up the rough edges just a bit this is an easy 5 star for me. It was worth the money to try. I'd recommend going when it's not busy. Lunchtime or a weekday.

The owners must have read the mediocre reviews this place was getting becuase in my opinion, the quality of the food here has improved significantly from my last visit circa Nov. 2015.   The sashimi tasted fresh, especially the tuna (at least that is what she said...LOL).  Serioulsy, today's Sasa Sashimi lunch combo with its accompaniments was delicous and the perfect size too  - the miso soup was hot, the salad was green and the draft Asahi was cold of course, like it should be.

There is absolutely nothing that separates this place from hundreds of other AYCE sushi joints across the valley, aside from maybe convenience. We came on a Friday night and the place was pretty busy. It is very apparent that the staff does not know how to handle busy peaks. We had three semi clueless people servicing our table. It was very bizarre. 

We ordered three rolls, an order of nigiri, and green mussels. One of the three servers brings out the "Mussels".I point out that we ordered mussels and he informs that's what was in front of us.  I politely inform him that in fact I have seen a mussel or two in my day, and this was some type of a leaf tempura, not mussels. He looks confused, then he rushes off and comes back to inform us that it's really a complimentary chef's creation, and our mussels were going to be out shortly. Wow. I mean how could you even confuse the two? 

The fish was not fresh and the creations were pretty much all the same thing. The service was extremely lackluster and a toddler slipped and fell as the family was leaving. They promptly grabbed the "wet floor" sign and put it up. They did check if the tot was okay, but then rushed to cover their butt. I mean, when the kid slipped it was apparent there was spilled water on the ground. Someone could have seriously injured themselves, or as a pregnant woman I shudder to think what could have happened. 

Nothing about this experience warrants going back.

Second trip to Sasa.  Gave a second chance with unfortunately the same results.  For all-you can eat menu, it's much less than other similar venues that offer a bigger menu and better quality.  The real trick here is assuming you have steady service throughout your meal.  Here however, they like to disappear for long periods of time.  Seems convenient for an all you can eat option that they want to slow your ordering.  I'd say this was just coincidence, but again second visit with the same service.  For $26 each, I expect to be able to order more off of your lesser menu.  My bad, but no worries, we won't be back.   We brought family here from out of town and had to apologize for our selection.  Lesson learned.  Mango Mochi at the end slightly improved the experience, but not enough to move out of the 2 star rating.  PS--Waiting on Check now for 20 mins without anyone approaching the table.  This place isn't busy right now.

My boyfriend and I have been here a few times and I have to say it's probably one of our favorite sushi places. The service is good, they're all really nice and attentive. Their poke salad though is definitely a MUST TRY. It is the best one I've had. It has a combination of tuna, yellowtail, and salmon along with some seaweed salad. Which is why I always get it whenever we come. Their mango crunch roll is also a good one to try if you're into the sweet and savory, the first time we went there, our waitress recommended it and I was skeptical at first because of the mango and cream cheese combo, but I was sold on it! It was actually very good. My boyfriend enjoyed their orange tiger roll a lot more though, so that's another one to try if you like sweetness.

Was in town for New Year's and decided to check this place out. 

Food:
I've had better quality of fish but this was a cool place to try out; they had flying fish roe which I've never had before but don't think I'll come back just because there are places that have better fish for the same price. 

Service:
Sat at the sushi bar and ordered AYCE sushi for their lunch price. I'd recommend sitting at the bar so you can ask the sushi chef questions and give precise orders. They're very creative and accommodating; he gave us plates that we didn't order and all were pretty good! I made a custom order and he was able to make it for me, no problem. :)

This place is amazing !! Upon walking in we were greeted by the nice hostess which kindly directed us to the bar . The sashimi here is extremely inexpensive we ordered 2 sashimi appetizer and one chirashi bowl . Total ONLY came out to be around 25 bucks. Our sushi chef was extremely nice and offered wonderful suggestions. When the sashimi came out it tasted extremely fresh! Overall wonderful experience!! Also what's pretty cool is they offer AYCE sushi!

My first impression of this place was awful as the hostess is dreadful at best.  I cannot believe she the first person customers have to encounter at Sasa.  I'd suggest the owners/manager provide her some training in customer service.  She did not make us feel warm or welcome at Sasa.  We decided to stick it out and are glad we did.  The rest of the employees we encountered were fantastic.  The food itself was all very tasty and presented well.  I like that they don't cram everything with as much rice as possible.  All of the rolls were pretty good and there wasn't any food that we did not enjoy.  The desserts offered were pretty decent alsol

The ambiance was okay and it is clear they have a lot of regulars.  I think this place would do better if they made first timers feel welcome and perhaps talk up the place a little.  Maybe recommend some of the rolls that are unique to Sasa.

We almost walked out and said "F-It" after our encounter with the host during arrival.  I'm happy we stayed and may consider coming back.  I would gladly take a poor host and great food over a great host and poor food.

We got the AYCE option in this restaurant in a strip mall.  Dinner was $26 and it was a bargain for the things that we ordered.  They offer everything on their menu for AYCE price; even sweet shrimps (they fried the heads and presented them on a bed of lettuce!) The fish was fresh and the service is really prompt and friendly.  We ordered multiple times and wait staff was accommodating and happy to give us what we wanted.  Only thing I wish could be different was their rice; I thought it was a bit hard for my taste.

Real talk. First time here.  My husband and I were set on 2 rolls.  All you can draught Sapporo can't be done without all I can eat. Then I got the nod from Nick, the bomb sushi chef, and it was nothing short of exceeding expectations. Service. Check. Quality of food. Check. Ambiance. Check. We are most definitely coming back, again. Don't miss out!

My first time her and it was Valentines day,but come on w/ 4 people working behind the sushi bar we shouln't have to wait 30 for each sushi order. We ordered a lot of doubles and never got the second. I ordered the Bento box and it all came 10 mins a part so by the time everything came i end up boxing it up and not hungry. My husband did all u can eat and was very disapointed he walked out.

I give very few five star reviews but I can find nothing to mark these guys down for.  The atmosphere is a 10 especially knowing what it was before!  Food was amazing, service and the server herself just a joy.  Chris one of the manager (potentially an owner) came and chatted with us.  He is proud, as he should be, of this establishment.  We did lunch AYCE.  There were two of us and we put away more than we thought we would!  First off and most importantly, they allow half rolls for the WHOLE duration!  
Veggie Tempura - nice portion, split between two of us about three pieces each.

Shrimp Tempua - Only two pieces if I were to go back I would ask for more.

Calamari - YUMMO!!!!!

Japanese Lasagna - excellent, probably the best I have ever had.

Mighty Roll - Excellent

Sasa Roll - minus the sriracha   sauce - great flavor combo.

Bank Roll - Standard but that is nothing bad ;)

We were too full for dessert, but that tempura ice cream is definitely happening next time.  As is a dash into their great sake selection.

Great portions of fish on nigiri. Very tasty food. The selection of rolls could be a bit better though. They are getting 3 stars because of the one male server who seems to hate his life lol. Every time he serves us, he looks so irritated or bored and inattentive. He will take too long to take your order to you and refill your drink. But the female servers are extremely nice and attentive. Would love to give at least 4 stars, but I expect better service when I'm paying 30 plus dollars per person, for the meal.
Mixed experiences here. Generally not high quality fish. Service is hit or miss. Price is average.

I love this place. It's tucked away on the egde of a strip-mall but they still manage to have great atmosphere. The sushi has a really fresh taste and you get a generous cut with nigiri. I don't go to vegas that often but I was surprised at the quality of this place since I eat a lot of sushi in hollywood and mostly find that the further inland I go the worse the sushi is. Good sake list too.

Yummy sushi! Recently moved to Summerlin & was looking for a good sushi spot nearby. Found the place!
Been wanting to try Sasa out after a bunch of recommendations from friends. My husband has been here before with coworkers & also said it was great!

Lots of items to choose from on the menu! There's something's that aren't on the menu that were good too. Like the 'star leaf'? Can't remember. Super good! 
The server at first seemed rude but warmed up to us later. Only reason for taking off one star because it wasn't a good first impression. 
Other than that everything was great. 
Oh & try the pineapple sake! YUM! 
Will be back frequently! Lol

We usually go to a Krazy Sushi for AYCE. Husband wanted to try somewhere new and heard about Sasa from friends.
This place is fast! The selection is amazing and the best part was I didn't have to dislocate my jaw to get a piece of overly riced nigiri into my mouth!
It looks as if you're getting a smaller bite, but I prefer the rice fish ratio here. I can actually taste the fish!
Service was a little chaotic because we had three different servers, but it really added to the AYCE, especially if you come hungry like we did!

I can't wait to go back, prices are better, size and selection is better. Overall, a great experience!

I really love sushi but this place was a huge disappointment. The amount of rice per roll was atrocious, way too much. And majority of their rolls where dry not only because of their rice tasting stale but because they lacked flavor. The tuna in all the dishes as this old taste to it. The servers are not very attentive either and kept asking me if I wanted half rolls, as if I could not finish them. It just was not a good experience and I will not be returning...

Came here for the sushi..stayed for the chefs! This place is awesome. Atmosphere was fantastic Nick and Kevin are great. Their attitude was pleasant and funny. The rolls were yummy and fresh..and even accommodated me who is a non fishy fish eater. They asked what I liked and handed me a roll that was to die for. This is definitely our new sushi place on this side of town. My husband did AYCE and loved it ALL. Look no further people and come here.
The service is great! All you can eat menu is the best! Will definitely be back! Great value for the price. The Spider Roll is the bomb!

FANTASTIC. Fish is amazing, rolls are gorgeous creations, and the chefs are welcoming and attentive. 

I'm new to AYCE sushi and this was a crash course in ease and satisfaction.

Check out Sasa Sushi!!

The Catapillar roll is very good, however everything else that we tried on the AYCE menu, came with a very dry sticky rice, not the normal sushi rice. If you're not ordering something with sauce, plan on drinking lots of water or Sake to wash it down

The majority of the low reviews for this place are based on receiving poor service or very late delivery. With this in mind, I grabbed takeout but my limited interaction with the staff was positive and I appreciated how quick they were.

The SASA 99 BENTO BOX is a great value- it's on the lunch menu but they allowed me to order it at 6PM. Order consists of 9 pieces of chef-selected sashimi, 9 pieces of nigiri, a choice of one basic roll (I went with the California), soup and salad. The cuts of fish were generous and thick, and noticeably fresh. I was pleased to see that the California roll was packed with crab and used minimal rice. Soup and salad were forgettable, but for $17, this was a great deal and a giant amount of food. Added on a 3-piece of gyoza (tasty but the wrappers were thicker than I'm used to) and it was enough for dinner AND lunch the next day.

I wasn't blown away by my order but I was decently surprised- so many AYCE places shaft you by packing on the rice, giving thin cuts of fish, etc but I would come back here again, either for the same order or to try something different.

Service was ok. Had the delux bento. Not what I expected for the price. I could have gotten the same portion at another spot I go to for less and the food would have actually been warm. Parkings free staff was friendly. Might need a do over at least once more to see if my ratings will change for this place.

Well,  if you're interested in being belittled and called fat for asking where the fucking oysters come from, you've found your new sushi spot!  

My boyfriend out of curiosity asked where the oysters came from and was immediately offered comments like, the ocean and lake mead. If you don't know, say you don't know or at least pretend to care enough to find out.  After the neo bro giggles from both clearly passionate sushi chefs you could hear them talking shit about our fat asses and portion control.   Seriously?  I'm paying to sit here and eat mediocre food while being insulted.

I don't usually take the time to write reviews unless I had a really horrible experience...which we did.  Surprisingly this place has decent reviews so I'm sure this comment doesn't equate to much but no one wants subpar sushi and to deal with insults over one question.  Dude acted like he was the keeper of this establishment, get over yourself.   Go to Oyshi for better quality and less attitude.
This place has gone downhill. Incorrectly orders; fish of questionable quality. Today I got ikura that tasted spoiled and nearly vomited.

Just ate at sasa sushi thanks to yelp. This place is mediocre. Service was slow. The food is decent. They don't take the time to trim the ruff parts from fish. Some salads lacked flavor and had tuff tuna. The price was way to high for the level of sushi. Plus they took forever to serve. There are better places in this area  with more selection. I will not return. The only thing good is the all you can drink beer for 5$ more. If I could give a 2 and a half star I would.

I had the Deluxe Lunch Combo. Great value. Salmon and tuna sashimi, shrimp & veggie tempura, California roll, chicken teriyaki, gyoza, miso soup and a toss salad for $14!  Food was great!  Server not that friendly, but he did his job. Would have gotten a 5 star if server had more personality. Will definitely come back for the AYCE sushi!

This place is amazing! I searched for over a year to replace the sushi joint I left behind when I moved here, and this is most definitely it. The staff is wonderfully friendly and, since I've become somewhat of a regular, they know all my favorite orders by heart.
