One of my very favorite things here are the tempura shiso leaves with salmon. Very light, crisp, and totally to die for. They're not on the menu, so make sure you ask for them. They also have AYCD Sapporo or sale for $5, which is amazing!

I got the all you can eat and everything I had was delicious! The waitress was weird and awkward it was like she didn't know what to do but me and my husband sat at the bar and the chef was super cool and informative.

Service and food were ok until my mom got her bowl of rice and it was undercooked you can tell there were hard white grains in there . Bowl was still full minus one spoon full that she ate. we told the server and he brings back the same bowl of rice he had just microwaved it. That's not good customer service. We paid and left never coming back.

Came here with my sister on a Saturday night and did AYCE! WORDS CAN NOT DESCRIBE THE WAY MY MOUTH FELT. Sushi was amazing and they have all you can drink Sake!!!! 2 for 1= ONE HAPPY GIRL. Another bonus from this place is that the chefs create something special while you await for your order to come in between meals. So awesome because the chef knew exactly what we liked based on knowing what we were ordering. Definitely be coming back.

Disappointment is an understatement. The sushi was not good definitely have had better and fresher. Super white tuna was tiny! And flavorless. The Japanese lasagna roll was cold! The cream cheese on top was warm but the combination of cold roll and hot topping was odd, and by odd I mean bad, and by bad I mean horrible! The service was pretty shitty, I shoulda sat at the bar. I was getting really angry after having been seated for 15 minutes and had not received my water or even wasabi or ginger. Now that I think about it I NEVER got the wasabi or ginger throughout my whole meal. The server was nice when she came around. She did get tied up cashing out a large party so we can't blame her for that. But seriously she was gone for like 20 minutes. The poor guy next to me got up from the table and took his empty cups up to her so she could refill them. The sushi chefs seemed nice but I absolutely will not be back there.

Best sushi in the area. All you can eat and drink. Great prices
Recommend Sasa roll, Birthday cake, onion lover, tuna carpaccio, mango crunch, Japanese lasagna bomb.

They do very good work.  The quality, in my opinion, is the best you can get for ayce in this town.  They have a great variety of nigiri and their rolls are great.  The place is very clean and the food is worth the trip.  Highly highly recommend.

Sasa Sushi is a joke, because of them I need to go back and re-evaluate Tokyo Sushi House that I evaluated yesterday and up them to a 2 star, unfortunately Sasa Sushi is much worse and they truly deserve the covenant 1 star. 

I'm on a quest to rate all of the sushi establishments within 5 miles of where I work.  When I went to Sasa Sushi today for lunch, I walked in at 12:10pm and I was the only person in the restaurant, other than 2 sushi chefs, the host/waiter and what I believe to be the owner. 
So there I am one person with the honor of having 4 individuals tend to my sushi needs. Under these circumstances, you would believe the sushi I was about to ingest would be amazing, why not, without any other tables or orders to distract the sushi chef from my order, I was sure I was in for a sushi experience like no other. 

I immediately asked for extra wasabi and my waiter Ronald was quick to respond, nothing fancy mind you like you would normally see in other restaurants, just a small round plate with ginger and wasabi just thrown on the plate, very messy presentation. So I began to mix my normal soy sauce with wasabi and noticed the wasabi had no heat, so I added even more wasabi in an attempt to make it hotter and to no avail. The wasabi was clearly not fresh; I ended up with a paste so thick in an attempt to get some heat that you would have thought I was mixing grout for bathroom tile work. 

I ordered the Poke Salad and it appeared very nice but I was a little taken back by the sweetness.  I then ordered the Kamikaze Roll and my usual Unagi Hand Roll so that I can gauge the quality of fresh fish to come by sampling the fresh water eel, oh my god, I nearly passed out with disgust as to what was brought to my table.  The eel was burnt, cold and just simply hard to chew; the only other eel in my life that tasted even remotely similar to this was what I once found in a can in the supermarket. Being the only person in the restaurant, the eel should have been freshly broiled and come to my table still warm, instead it was cold, burnt and had a consistency of beef jerky. I would be embarrassed if I took a client here, ashamed really. 

I ended up sending both the eel hand role and the spicy tuna hand role back when they arrived because nearly 80% of the roll was rice and virtually no protein. Again, the eel was horrible, If I had to lay money down and bet, I would say the eel came from a can and was not fresh at all.  

I went on to order Albacore and it came out dry and looked like someone had already chewed it and put it back on the plate (cuts all across the fish). I also ordered the Surf Clam and this came out slimy, surf clam never has a slimy sheen on it unless it's old. 
I was trying so hard to make this place work, I tried as much as I could to see if I could find something on the menu to make the trip to Sasa Sushi enjoyable and worth it, but I just couldn't. 

I ordered the Salmon Skin hand roll and it was the worst I had ever tasted in my life, the Salmon Skin was pieces of skin about 4-5inches long sticking out of the hand roll, not 1 or 2 pieces but what appeared to be the whole damn salmon, it was truly overkill. When I bight into the Salmon Skin hand roll, there was such a load crunch I believe people were looking around to see if metal was crumpling from a car accident outside. It was awful, I felt like I was eating a pork rind hand roll, it was way to crunchy and just too much of it. I then ordered the PCH Roll thinking, not too complicated, it's a roll with only three little letters for a name, so I thought to myself, as long as there wasn't any more of that dreadful eel in the roll, maybe this roll will be a winner. Who knew, how do you screw up a roll that has Tuna, Salmon, Cream Cheese and Avocado; simple, cut the pieces so big you need someone without just in case you need someone to perform the Heimlich Maneuver on you when you choke. Only 6 piece came out where there should have been 8 and possible 10 for a cut roll, the pieces were just too thick to be enjoyable, nobody wants that much cream cheese in their mouth at one time, unless you're sitting down to put the hurt on a lox bagel. 

Sushi is about freshness, textures, flavors, combinations of flavors and the perfect balance of vinegar rice to raw fish. If any of these are not correct, it ruins the entire sushi experience.  

Sasa Sushi reminds me of amateur hour at the Laugh Factory, although they did get a laugh out of me, as I said when I opened, what a Joke. I couldn't believe I was actually paying money for this crap, just about anyone could read a book at home and learn how to cut, prepare and assemble better tasting sushi than Asaa sushi. Don't waste your time and money going here, there's just not enough customers for the fish to be fresh, hence the Unagi in a can, slimy Surf Clam and already chewed Albacore.

Used to be a regular customer until today. Walked in and an a-hole of a manager told us the wait was 3 hours. Complete dick about the whole situation, and never made eye contact. I will never go back.
The food, the service, the sushi Chefs are all  awesome! The sushi is fresh and the beer cold. Thank you
Not too bad of a place! I've been there a couple of times already and the food is great! The service is a little awkward though, but they're all nice.
Pretty much the best sushi I have ever had. Excellent sushi and a great all you can eat deal!

By far the best ayce sushi in vegas! Fish is fresh, kitchen menu for my kids is delicious and all you can eat and drink for a low price, you can't beat that anywhere else. And best part is mochi is unlimited too!! The Staff is super friendly and outgoing. My number ONE spot for sushi hands down :)

I LOVE this place! AYCE is very affordable at $26 per person for Dinner and $22 for lunch. My boyfriend and I have been going here so often you can consider us regulars. The sushi chefs already know our favorites, and as we are paying for AYCE, they are always giving us new things to try. My favorite being the "just eat it" lol! The food is delicious, the chefs are entertaining and helpful when you're not sure what to order, and it's a great place to just stuff your face and hang out for some good times :)
I  love Sasa. The sushi is fresh and the staff is wonderful.  I love their garlic ponzu. I wish they would bottle it.

Great place, AYCE and all you can drink for xtra $5. This place is awesome,  great food,  friendly,  you can do half rolls,  the roll are not all rice so you don't get filed up right away. We are so happy we came here for lunch. Definitely going to come back for more. Great for kids too, they weren't eyeballing my kids for the AYCE. Our server,  didn't get his name, was excellent. I'm hoping nothing changes because we love sushi and this is for sure going to be our regular spot!

We are back again to some great sushi  Don was our chef
And the preparations and seafood was delicious.

Been here a couple times and the rolls aren't really anything special. It's just okay. This time around a few days ago I was happy to hear music but the service is kind of meh. We had the same waiter both times and he doesn't seem very friendly. I'd rather eat at my other favorites in town but only came because it seemed to have good reviews.

Everything i had was so yummy.
Tried uni for the first time.
And oysters. Oh my.
Manny made my first time here amazing.
Thank you. I will be back.

Amazing food, amazing atmosphere, amazing wait staff! Had a fantastic girls night with all you can drink beer or sake and all you can eat sushi. I honestly can't wait to go back! I found my new favorite sushi place.

My two friends and I had dinner. We did not eat AYCE, we ordered combo plates. Only 2 out of the 3 dinners were served, we waited for a waitress to appear to ask about the 3 dinner. She stated that the cooks were making it. Then, approximately 5-10 minutes past and another waitress came up to apologize saying that the cook had forgotten to make it and that the food was being prepared. Meanwhile, we were almost finished with our dinners, my friend did not feel hungry anymore and had canceled his order. The food is only mediocre and the service was lacking. There was no excuse because they were not busy, literally it was my table and 2 people at the sushi bar. It's such a shame because it's close to our house, but we won't return there again!!
Love this place! Tuna sashimi is to die for. The taste of freshness in your mouth just melts.
Absolutely ama-za-zing food lol and service was on point. Definitely coming back again
Decided to come here randomly because we wanted sushi. We were pleasantly surprised at how good it was and great prices! Def will come back. (:

This sushi joint is fantastic.  They treated me so well when I told them that it was my first time.  Manny and Nick are FANTASTIC sushi chefs and they are so fun to hang out with.  Seriously, they should get raises...  I can't believe how much stuff I got to try, and it was all delicious.  I will definitely be coming back!!

I'm always hesitant to try new sushi places because there's a few that I go to all the time, that I absolutely love, but am disappointed a lot when trying other ayce places. I put in sushi near me and this place popped up. It had good reviews for the most part, so we thought why not? 

I'm glad we decided to check this place out. The food was amazing. My boyfriend is very picky. He only likes to go to Yama Sushi, but I convinced him to try this place and try new rolls and he was amazed. We asked what rolls were recommended and tried all the ones they told us about and I dont have anything bad to say about any of them. We just went for it and tried a bunch of their rolls and all were worth it. I like red bean ice cream, but am iffy about the grainy beans in it, but I tried it here and it was better than I've ever had at any other sushi place. There were a lot more we wanted to try, but ran out of room in our bellies for anymore. Lol

One complaint I had that dropped my rating down, was the time it took to receive our food. We ordered a bunch of stuff right away because we knew some things take longer than others to get. Well, a few things we waited and waited for, at least 30 minutes, and nothing. We finally asked and they forgot to put them in, yet never came to check on us after they saw all our plates were empty for awhile. Their service could definitely be improved, to make sure customers are getting waited on quickly, but we will definitely try it again. By the time we were leaving the place was packed and people were waiting outside, but when we got there, there were a lot of open tables, so you may want to go on an off hour and not dinner time, if you don't want to wait.

Good portions of negiri vs sushi rice.
Attentive servers.
Awesome rolls. Will be back.

Sasa is my favorite AYCE sushi place. The chefs are amazing and are willing to create you customized rolls based on what you like. The AYCE price of $25.95 can't be beat. Their quality of fish and the fish per rice ratio is just right. Other AYCE places around Vegas give you thin slivers of sashimi on top of your nigiri. Sasa gives you generous portions of their fresh selection of fish. For dessert you must try their mango mochi and their tempora ice cream, it's amazing! Service here is on point and you will leave here full and happy!

6 months later and we wouldn't think of trying another sushi restaurant. Everything tastes so fresh down to the sprouts and garnishes. Why go elsewhere? Oh did I mention the personable chefs and great atmosphere?

Okay, I hate leaving bad reviews but I ordered to go from this restaurant and while the service I received when I went in was great, I had a couple of issues:

First, this place smelled. Bad. When I went in I could barely breathe I don't know how people were eating in there.

Two, my rolls just weren't that good I threw the rest away. I got a rainbow roll and two orders of nigiri. Their spicy mayo wasn't mixed and tasted terrible. 

Please take more time to quality control your food and take care of your restaurant! If you have maintenance issues close the restaurant, don't let people eat in a bad smelling environment.

Lastly, I'm confused how this place has four stars! Really wanted to like this place and I don't enjoy writing bad reviews but the reviews below mis-led me and I don't want others to be led astray.
Just went here. The sushi was delicious, our server Rick was super funny and the chefs were awesome. They gave us some delicious oranges after everything, too.

On a busy weekend night, with a full restaurant, why would you only have one server on? First of all, she was frazzled and stressed the whole time we were there. Second of all, service was extremely slow and mediocre. We got all you can eat sushi but we shouldn't have had to wait 30 minutes just for our first roll. The quality of the tuna was eh.

My good friend says stay away from the spicy lol it's super delicious here. If you're a sushi lover, then this is the place for you. Nick is amazing and can make you anything you want. I told him what I like in a roll and he delivered. Amazing :) also, first time trying pineapple sake and it was ok.

Honestly the best sushi place I've been too in Vegas. The best AYCE deal around. Servers are very nice and the food is very fresh.  

Every roll is good, I don't necessarily have a favorite.  

If you go for dinner you are able to order the special items for AYCE that you cannot order during lunch :  uni, oyster shooters, sashimi and some other meat items.   
(My mouth is watering while I'm writing this). I would highly recommend going for dinner just for these specials :)

Did I mention all you can drink??? 8$ a person for beer and saki, and 5$ just for one of them.  

Amazing place and wouldn't go anywhere else for AYCE.

Best sushi place in Vegas! Definitely worth the trip if you live far. The all you can eat is good but if you don't feel like eating a lot, the Sasa 99 is worth trying. The staff is also the best, they're friendly and will help you decide what rolls and nigiri to try out. Tip: sit by the bar.

Skip it. Lame service, bad music, sushi was so cold seemed just thawed. Albacore was horrible. Just not worth the time or money. Don't understand the good reviews. Go to Sushi Mon, Sen of Japan or Kabuto (in ascending order).
Best sushi I've had in a long time. The Jane Roll is a must! Our server Melisa was great! I'll be coming every week to get my sushi fix!
Steve W. No doubts Nick makes wonderful creations of sushi and sashimi,Sashas tuna,albacore,soft shell crab,calamari are so delicious and the atmosphere is awesome a must try all is great.

I love Sasa Sushi! It's the best. Great customer service. Very friendly. The Sushi is delicious. We have tried lots of places in the area  but we always come back to Sasa Sushi. They allow half rolls  and they don't overload their rolls with rice.

I came here last night to visit a friend of mine at work and was surprised and happy to find that this place was actually quite a rare find. All the staff were extremely friendly including the manager (who is insanely tall btw). The chefs that work at the bar are the absolute best though. From working in kitchens at several restaurants I can tell when people work well together and these guys definitely had some flow. 

I had the AYCE sushi buffet. The sushi was great and I like that they had pork belly on the appetizer menu which was delicious. My favorite thing that I had was the 10k roll which isn't on the menu but one of the chefs own creation. 

Overall 5 stars for great friendly and timely service as well as great food! I will definitely be back again!

This is our go to sushi spot even though we don't live anywhere close to it.  

The guys that work here ROCK.   I've got a serious scallop allergy and my daughter a allergy to crab and in the few years that we've come here they've never once cross contaminated our meals, which is the number one way to make me not eat someplace.  Also they get to know the customers and have built a great chef to consumer relationship with my family.  Our favorite thing is that we can walk in and not even have to order off of the menu.  They know and remember the things that we like and some of the one we don't.  They also surprise us with some amazing creations that off menu.  

We bring all of our friends here when they visit from out of town and they've all said its some of the best and freshest fish that they've had in Vegas.   

The fish and food is also fresh, tasty and never has that off fishy taste that is often found in local ayce places.  

I've seen a few bad reviews of late and I'd like to say too that the guys that work here are a fun bunch.  Some people need to lighten up and just learn to have some fun while Dealing with chefs.  Also, In all the time that I've been here I've never once seen/heard them call someone names. I'm a woman of size and have never been treated disrespectfully by any of the staff. 

So.   You want a good sushi place in the NW. Give Sasa a try.  You won't be disappointed.
The fish here is AMAZING! Service was great, wonderful atmosphere and the remodel did wonders for the ambiance. Would recommend to anyone who likes sushi.

Good service. The rolls and nigiri were pretty good. Salmon nigiri was the perfect size and was very fresh. My husband and I did AYCE and left in a food coma. You also get 1 order of sashimi with your AYCE which is cool. The restaurant itself is clean and has decent decor/ambience. It's nice that they had ESPN on during our meal since it is football season.

We'll be coming back :)
I went to this Sushi place for my birthday and the sushi was really good ! $25 all you can eat , I recommend the shrimp tempura roll and the mango mochi !

This place was great all around! It was very clean inside. All the staff was very friendly. My husband and I ordered AYCE and everything was perfect. Our waitress also sent rolls over to try. We left very satisfied and happy. We will definitely return again soon!

First time trying this place out. We got to the place around 10:45 pm. Ordered. Delivery of the food was pretty quick, less than 5 minutes. The rolls were pretty awesome and yummy! Especially the Mochi ice creams! The only problem we had was our server. The server we had was kinda rude so that made the experience suck a little. I don't think I'll try this place out again.

Ordered pick-up. Bank Roll was missing almost all of its marquee ingredients. Our Sasa 99's didn't have their rolls. Forgive-able until we saw the fish quality. They're serving scraps as sashimi! We've managed real sushi bars like Roku. We know fish. Discolored globules on salmon? Thin stringy, veiny Mackerel? Mgmt refused to deliver or refund us. Desperately tried to make us take credits towards future purchases. Like we'd try to eat their crap sushi again? Avoid this place. They truly suck at everything. Lighting was ultra-bright (reason for take-out), server was flustered and clueless... No points for any of it.

The server was very rude. Didn't smile at all. We had to call him over at least 3 times to fill up our water cups and the sushi was mediocre for such poor service. The miso soup was bland. 

I do not recommend coming here.

Well this was well worth the trip on a Friday night! Even though for me it was only two blocks. Lolololol.

Great sushi, great service and the prices were phenomenal!
The sushi was on the dry side. The katsudon lacked the flavor and sauce. Had high hope but was disappointed. Will not be going back.

Great service. Delicious sushi. Our server brought us a few dishes to try. Everything he brought to our table was delicious. We ordered
the Playboy and it was refreshingly perfect for this hot summer day. Big bonus: they serve green tea ice cream!

Really close and convenient to where I live, fair price for the AYCE and the sushi is good for an AYCE as well. Will def be back to try more of their chef specials. My favorite roll was the Onion Lover and the pepperfin.

Let me start by saying that ever since moving to Vegas a year ago we would go and bring our 15 year old son here EVERY month.  We loved it and the guys that work there.  That being said this is what happened yesterday to me and my husband!
We walked in and went to the "bar" area, ordered two beers and one glass of ice water.  As always the waiter said, "are you having AYCE?" As always we said no.  Between the two of us we only need one or two rolls and getting the ayce is a waste of money.  Well the guy who we have never had before said that we will regret not getting the ayce and then laughed.  So we went on to get a salmon roll and japanese lasagna.  The salmon roll was delish (as always) the japanese lasagna on the other hand was hideous.... GROSS!!!  Then we ordered yellow fin tuna roll and that was also really good. 
Then here came the bill.... our bill was over $40!  we figured around $25.  The rolls are usually $4 the beers around $3.50 and the yukey japanese lasagna was close to $8.  Well after looking at the breakdown after the sticker shock!!!  They charged us for the sushi on the other side of the menu and not what we clearly pointed to on the menu.  The Hawaiian roll $9.95 and the $8 for the lasagna and Hamanchi Lover's Roll $10.50!  Making our total bill as much as the "AYCE" he was right we would regret not getting the ayce!  Ayce is $21.95 each but we only ordered and pointed to the rolls we wanted.  This was not our first rodeo here and we know what we order and have done so for OVER a year. The sushi chef knew what we pointed to and the waiter rang it up the way he wanted to.
NEVER AGAIN even though we do love this place but buyer be aware!!!!  Make it VERY clear what you are ordering and double check!  
Sad for us but NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This is definitely a place to go to escape work during lunch. No matter how bad your day is these guys Nick, Kevin, Manny, Donald and Ron! Way to go fellas. All you can eat, All you can drink. It's like a dinner and a show when Nick is there!

All selections are superb! I would recommend to all of my friends and family.  The owner and our server Dalia, she is the best!   I liked all of her recommendations from the menu.  This is officially my favorite place for AYCE sushi restaurant!

I've been here quite a few times for the AYCE and have never been disappointed.  Food is consistently good as well as their service. Everyone there is nice and attentive. Have tried many of their rolls but I've got to say that the Sasa roll is the best. It's a great place but it's not the best sushi place I've ever been too but definitely much better than other places I've been to, AYCE or not. Will definitely keep coming back.

Ehhh. The AYCE sushi menu is frustrating because most of the rolls have the same ingredients so you are risking getting a mouth full of ONE FLAVOR!!! I can in an hour before closing ordered 2 appetizers and maybe three different roles that we're not impressive at all. For dessert I ordered the green tea Mochi. It was good but I would not order it again maybe in a different flavor. I was not impressed and do not feel the need to go back to try again I have a favorite restaurant but it's also all you can eat on South Maryland Boulevard. Hope your experience was better than mine.

Went to this place after our normal sushi place had a really long wait (naka sushi just down the street). We should have just waited there. This place is horrible. The sushi menu is small compared to other sushi places. No idea where people are getting extensive menu from. Ordered the orange tiger roll and nearly three up in my mouth. The service is terrible. I had to ask multiple times for a side of eel sauce. Waiter brought us someone else's food and we tried declining it but he said that we did order it and have to eat it if we ordered it. WTF? Nigiri tastes awful here and the fish does not seem very fresh. Stay the hell away from this place.
I really enjoy this place for lunch. The all you can eat and drink is dangerous. Glad that we walked here.

This used to be my favorite. My family makes it to Sasa on average twice a month because the food is so good, but last night there were so many minor issues that they added up to one lackluster visit.  First, it smelled bad as we walked in.  Then we ordered green tea and that even smelled stronger than usual that night.  We order 4 rolls and 3 appetizers but we finished all our rolls before we even got our appetizers because service was so slow and then when our first appetizer came, another foul smell of burning metal came from the kitchen with it.  The teriyaki beef, a go-to favorite, was old and dryer than usual.  Their new recipe fried calamari which was so delicious on our last visit was inedible this time.  The sushi rice was old and the wasabi was not its usual bright green color.  Again, I know Sasa so we will probably go back in two weeks despite this one bad experience but if we have this same low quality food next time, it will be our last visit.  It's just too expensive to have low quality food.  I have not seen the owners for a while so I wonder if it is under new ownership.

DELICIOUS!!! I was looking to try a new sushi spot and I'm so glad I found Sasa. Manny, our sushi chef was so pleasant. I loved watching him prepare our food. Everything was so nicely presented.  We had poké, sashimi, salmon skin salad, Japanese nachos, Mark's roll, some hand rolls, and a bunch of other goodies. 

I'll definitely be back!

Based on yelp reviews we came here for date night. I'm so glad we did!  Wasn't to busy when we got here and the service was amazing. Our first roll was out in minutes and the next 2 were at the table before that one was done. We did the AYCE and everything was fresh, fast, well plated and delicious.  The pain in the A $$ roll was our favorite, not that any were bad we had the a Washington, Alex's munchie, big Cajun, paradise, mango crunchy, and pain in the a $$.  All were great. We will be back.

NOT GOOD !!!I'm a big foodie and love having my one cheat meal on the weekends .. Was excited to go out and eat sushi but was VERY DISAPPOINTED .... Within minutes got sick and had to leave ... Not worth going to ...DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY OR TIME ...

Delicious, affordable and clean. This is now my go-to sushi place. The lunch special is $10.95 and includes a salad, miso, 6 pieces of sushi & 6 pieces of sashimi. In summerlin that would probably be $20 and not as amazing.
2/3 sushi rolls had small beard hairs on them. Probably from the sushi chef with a beard. Server was a bit unwelcoming and seemed grumpy. Sushi tasted alright. For the price, not worth it.

Went in for the happy hour and sat at the bar with Donald. He was most gracious. I ordered a couple of simple items like a spicy tuna roll and snapper nigiri, and also some of the fancier items like the Orange Tiger roll, SSS Roll and Lisa Lisa. They are all fantastic. The fish was fresh and just the right amount of rice to fish ratio. I didn't do the AYCE, but it's a good deal, I just came by for the early happy hour but had to come back at dinner time to pick up some more food for my wife. 
Love the fact it's so close to my home.
Seriously my new favorite local all you can eat sushi spot!!   Ridiculously good food and an even more amazing staff!!  Friendly, fun, and delicious!!  Will be back often!!
This place was nice and clean but my roll was not good at all. The rice seem old and hard and not very flavorful. Hoping that it was just a one time bad experience.
Did the all you can eat sushi, had various nigiri, teriyaki steak, calamari, poke, dragon roll, shrimp tempura and dynamite. All of it was excellent and there is rarely a long line at this place

We always enjoy coming here with the family, especially with two little ones. They are accommodating, friendly fast-service and the food is delicious. AYCE is definitely worth it, so come hungry! They have a wide variety of specialty rolls. Hope you'll like it as much as we do

An easy four star review for me! One of the few AYCE sushi places I've seen here, and it's pretty great! 
Their menu isn't as big as some other similar styled restaurants, however, we weren't disappointed with the majority of the food and service we received. 
Me and my boyfriend came in fairly late, around 10:30. On Friday and Saturday, they close at midnight, and last call is about 11:30. The waiter was very kind about letting us read over the menu (the entire menu is available for AYCE!) I'm a huge fan of eel, and many of their rolls feature this delicious fish. Among our meal, we tried mainly their specialty rolls, the Mardi Gras being my personal favorite. 
I must say though, I was extremely disappointed with the baked Volcano roll I had. The rice was mushy, and mayo tasted overly sweet, and the scallops were rubbery and overcooked. Maybe it was on off night, but it was very off-putting. 
The waiter also brought us an oops roll. The chefs made a extra Screaming Orgasam, which was thoughtful to give to us, but we couldn't eat it! I'm horribly allergic to the green onions on the roll. So yay and boo :(

Overall, this place is certainly worth stopping by! Make sure your group isn't too big. It's a small place!
$5 all you can drink beer with all you can eat, and sushi chefs are great company. Need I say more? No!

Every time I come in either for lunch or dinner the food is always great and fresh. the service from the waiters and chefs are always friendly and polite. It's a nice hole in the wall place to chill and eat

It's alright. Not the worst but definitely not the best. My boyfriend and I were the only ones in the restaurant and we still waited for sushi while the staff chit chatted in the back and walked by my sushi that had been done for almost 10 minutes at least 4 times. I wanted to get up and get it myself. 
The noodles were good and I was pleasantly surprised they had strawberry saki. 
Over all it wasn't terrible, but I probably won't come back anytime soon.
Amazing! Attentive service, great sushi! Try the pork belly, it was a great addition to our dinner

You must go here!

We used to go to this place when it was Sushi in Summerlin.  As with most sushi joints, they would have one good cut of fish and the rest and the best you could say about everything else was that it was "not off."  But it was cheap and close to home. 
 
Now it is Sasa Sushi.  Still cheap, but man what a difference!  Every single piece of fish was the perfect texture and taste for its specimen.  Too bad I ran out of room in my stomach!  My sushi dinners are about to increase 10 fold!
Best AYCE!! I come here multiple times a month!! I've been to other places but always find myself back here. My favorite roll is the Washington....total salmon lovers favorite!!

The food was yummy and there was a wide variety of sushi to choose from on the menu.  
My only wish is that portions were smaller so that I could have tried more items.  

Our server was fabulous, but she was the only one in the floor working.  She seemed a bit overwhelmed.  We went there on a Monday afternoon and while it was not too busy, it was too much for one person.

It is on our list of places to return to on our next trip to Vegas.

Three stars.
Ever since Alvin sold the place it hasn't been the same.
Anyone that knows the history of the place knows that's been a long time.
Sorry.
I'll spend the gas money to go to Sushi Bomb or Tokyo up the road.
What an amazing AYCE sushi night! Nick the sushi guru made me the most delicious sashimi and sushi! I will definitely be back for the tuna carpaccio!

Yummmmmmmmmy
I have gone here multiple times for the all you can eat menu. 
There is no reason that you should get anything else because you literally get the ENTIRE MENU 
And even the good stuff. 
Ask them about the Call Me Maybe roll it's a roll off the previous menu but suuuuuuuper tasty
Their fish is delicious and super fresh! 
And the service is great every time! The staff is always super friendly and the service is fast! 
Also if you add $5 a person to the AYCE you can get the All you can drink with their tap beer and sake! #epic 
Anyways this place is a must and reminds me of home in San Diego and is greatly priced! 
Definitely a gem in Las Vegas

I have been to many sushi restaurants, and this one hit the home run! Chef Manny knows everything about his fish and ingredients. Tempura is perfectly fluffy and crispy, and all the extra oil is drained before it is served to us so it is not greasy at all; his fish is carefully selected, processed and cut to make the perfect sushi items. He is a passionate perfectionist that is passionate about providing the best sushi experience to the customers. Scottish salmon is creamy and sweet, salmon roe is light, sweet and aromatic(unlike many sushi restaurants where salmon roe tastes salty and even a little bitter), spicy tuna on tempura mint leaves is perfectly balanced and light, yellow tail jalapeno is light in texture but rich in flavors. Highly recommended, try everything on the menu and you'll love them!

Ordered the Sasa 66 and the beef udon for lunch and it was a great deal!  The fish was nice and fresh, the california roll however doesn't keep well and wasn't that great the next day.  The udon noodles were a bit too salty for me but tasty nonetheless.  I can't wait to go for their AYCE.

Came in and only saw the AYCE menu on the table.. Freaked out for a minute cuz my kids and I weren't hungry enough for AYCE and I thought regular plates were also available.. Asked about ramen- and told the waiter I thought they had other plates and he said ramen was a special and pointed to a board.. Ok, so if he wasn't going to tell me the specials, I guess I had to get up to read them.. He finally offers the other menu.. Just seemed a little odd, but ok... Like, it was bothersome to get it...
So I ordered the Sasa 99, which was beautifully presented, but the sushi seemed warmer than what it should be.. It's sashimi and nigiri and a small roll of your choice of tuna, salmon and something else.. I ordered, and SAID, "2 Pork Katsu DON" pls.. The Katsu Don came with miso soup and salad, which I was totally impressed with and the bowl didnt have an egg.. I told the kids it's what I ordered though... 
So I asked the waiter why their Katsu Don didn't have an egg, he said it did.. I said that's what I ordered then..he said no you didn't.. Uh yes, I did.. I said pork Katsu Don.. He said no- you said pork Katsu only. That's fine.. U can argue with me.. No problem.. 
So, I went on to Yelp,  simply to see if I would get some sort of discount for checking in, and saw only the sake with an AYCE. My waiter, Tyler, approaches me again and says, "I see you're posting a review on Yelp.. Even IF you ordered the Katsu Don, the kids already started eating the food so I would have to charge you extra." Charge me extra for EGGS?!? Ooohhh... I told him I know what I ordered, and he again said, no- that's not what you said. I said You didn't need to come and argue with me. Seriously?! WTF?! 
Needless to say, water was never refilled,  checked up on us once, had to ask for napkins, and surprisingly, for the bill. They were getting 3 stars before the waiter approached me about the  Yelp review, so there's your 1 star.. 
I was excited about this place. How disappointing.
Free saki if you check in on yelp! Get down there! The sushi was high quality, prices were fair and service was great. Our new sushi place.

This place is amazing. I've been to almost every single AYCE sushi place in Vegas and this place is hands down the best AYCE sushi place I've ever been to. The thing I love about this place is that they get our order correct every time. I can't stress how important this is because almost every other sushi place tries to skimp on their food. For example, if i get 2 sashimi salad, they'll use one fish portion and split it between 2 salads, or if I get 4 orders of shrimp tempura, they'll only give 4 or 6 pieces and not 8. But this doesn't happen at Sasa Sushi. They give the correct portion and correct amount every time. They also don't forget our orders like other sushi places frequently do.

The food is all excellent and tasty, the ama ebi (sweet shrimp) was sooo good and they use the biggest shrimps I've ever seen in a sushi restaurant. Everything was extremely fresh, the uni, salmon belly, and even the crab sticks were excellent. Service was excellent as well and our waters never fell below half the cup the whole time. The food wait time was extremely short even though the restaurant was packed.

One thing though is that their rolls selections aren't that good, and 90% of the rolls are shrimp tempura rolls with cream cheese. I didn't see any lobster rolls or soft shelled crabs rolls which was disappointing. So if you are into rolls then I wouldn't recommend this place, but if you are into nigiri with huge fish to small rice ratio, sashimi (yes they serve sashimi for AYCE!!), appetizers like oyster shooter, spoon specials (ask the server for this), and desserts (UNLIMITED MOCHI!!!), this is hands down the best sushi place you'll find in Vegas.

The chefs David, Manny and the server Lynn were super awesome, friendly, and accommodating for anything. I loved everything I tried, especially the play girl and the tempura ice cream. I ordered seconds of the ice cream! My fiancé and I will definitely be coming back for more all you can eat! They say they will be updating their menu, so we can't wait to come in again soon. :)

Of all the sushi places I have been to in the twenty years I've been here, this was one of the worst. No greeting at the door, actually no response period. Wasn't that busy, 4 people at the sushi bar, where we wanted to sit, but the empty seats hadn't been cleaned yet. Had to wait for that . Absolutely no friendly interaction from the bald sushi chef when we sat down, didn't even acknowledge us. Too busy with the two tables behind us and the obese couple sitting in front of him to bother with us. When we did get his attention, never once looked at us or asked if we wanted anything, so ordering was an ordeal. In the meantime the husband of the large couple at the sushi bar was talking loudly on his cell phone, so we had to listen listen to that for the next 14 minutes, still trying to get the  Sushi chefs attention .
After only two hand rolls sloppily put together I was done. Have had better sushi at Smiths grocery store. Asked for check while listening to a kid screaming at the table behind us. Finally went up front, check was almost 60 dollars for maybe the thirty dollars worth of crap that was impossible to order. What a horrible experience. First time in twenty years I have ever not left a tip. The bald sushi chef was absolutely the most unfriendliness and unprofessional We have ever encountered. This was our first and last visit to this dump. Nice experience for Mother's Day?!

No big on reviewing and hate to give a bad review, but this place was.. Kinda bland. The menu was lack luster, the rolls all tasted the same. They all seem to have a hint of sweetness, which is something I really don't care for when eating sushi. The service was ok .The firecrackers were the only item I really enjoyed.
This is our favorite sushi place. The food is delicious!!! We love coming here including our 4 year old daughter. The staff is always helpful and they are always smiling.

The sushi place overall was decent. I was really upset at the fact that our waiter was rude and always acting like he is in a hurry. I don't remember his name, but he's this tatted up Asian guy. Needless to say, I won't be back here for the type of service I received. Later on, the waiter seemed a bit more sarcastic when we ordered because he kept walking away after we requested an order and we weren't even done. 

Do not try the tuna carpaccio. It wasn't all that great. They did give us a chefs special and it wasn't all that great. It was like a deep fried spinach with some weird fish on it.

Good food and happy hour prices are great as well. They havey husband' s favorite dish, Katsudon on the menu so that's a great too! We've been there plenty of times and are always treated very well and receive great service. Its close to home, so that's a plus!

This place is a hidden gem. Super fresh fish, and excellent customer service. We tried it because its really close to us. I think they opened fairly recently and not too many people have discovered it yet. Nick is awesome and will make specialty rolls for you and even made a cute bear with the orange left over from our dessert. Chris (yoshi) is also very attentive and will make anything special you request or make recommendations for you.
Food was really excellent. They might have the best version of salmon skin roll! Wish they staff was a bit nicer they seem cold and not wanting to be here otherwise all good.

Came to Sasa for the first time this evening for a delicious anniversary sushi affair. 
I was veryyyyyy pleasantly surprised! 
I've eyeballed this joint for sometime: on Yelp, when driving by, etc but for some odd reason was skeptical. Skeptics like me, be advised, this joint is not a joke. 
Fair prices, excellent service, the sushi chef made our visit. Such a friendly guy with great jokes. I love going to sushi places with awesome chefs that pride themselves on customer satisfaction. He went above and beyond to recommend rolls and make me something special! 
The bf greatly enjoyed his chicken teriyaki dinner and I pretty much ate my weight in sushi. Now excuse me while I let the glorious sushi coma take me....

Good service...great AYCE menu with a lot of variety in rolls. My husband and I usually just do nigiri at AYCE but this spot had some pretty interesting rolls & you can do half orders. We got Cajun roll & mango crunch (which was kind of like a dessert roll but very good). I also had the kamikaze which had nice sweet eel and crab (though it didn't say that on the menu and I usually don't like crab) but it was good too. Super white tuna was pretty fresh and buttery but less ponzu sauce than I usually like. Cajun was awesome & not dry like I've had at other places...great spicy Cajun sauce too. All the sushi chefs were friendly & kept asking how we liked everything. The dessert came out in an orange carved like a bear...pretty cute! They have a nice selection of sakes although I didn't get to try any bc I was too full. I definitely left probably 5 lbs heavier! Not too far from our house so we'll definitely be back!

Nom nom nom what a great place up on this side of town. Manny was an excellent sushi chef! He engaged in conversation with us and told us aout Hawaii. We began with about 2 rolls and then manny started sending out spontaneous things. There was the poke nachos and a sesame poke plate. What a great and knowledgable chef. The food was great too, plenty of selection. But if you feel adventurous insure the chef will just push food out.
The only reason why I took off a star was because one of the server was kinda cocky when we sat down at around 830, to find out later he was off at 9 so he was probably anxious to get off work.
I love it here. Food is delicious. We always stop by to this location when we travel to las vegas from Los Angeles

This place is superior to any other all you can eat sushi place around.  The nigiri is now done in tiny pieces, but this is fun because you can enjoy so many things without filling up too quickly.  If they have the carpaccio when you go, get it.  It is outstanding.  Fun rolls full of taste.  They'll do half rolls which is the best.  Again, more variety for the diners.  Keep up the great work Sasa!

Went here on a friday, did my usual sampling of the fish that I like to do at a new sushi place, tai, hamachi, maguro, etc.. All of the fish I tried was very fresh and really tasty. If there was rice it was a small amount and I was still able to enjoy the fish. This is not a place that tries to fill you up on rice. Satisfied as to the quality, I ordered some things I would order at a more familiar place, a few rolls, kama, appetizers. Everything was delicious and well prepared. Combine good service, great food, and a reasonably priced AYCE with optional all-you-can-drink and there isn't really more I could ask for.

P.S. A sixth star for being a block from my house.

My coworkers and I always order from sasa sushi to-do. There hand roll lunch special are BOMB and fair price. And there service is great they know their regulars.  #WellFargoTeam #WCheyenne #BombSushi

Went here with friends for dinner on a weekday. First, we were all hesitant to go in since there were only 2 people inside and it was 7pm already. We just decided to go in since we were already very hungry. 

We ordered several nigiris, tempura and sushi on a spoon which were decent.  Also ordered rolls: Paradise, Mountain and Bank. They were all average. Ordered the oyster shooter, mango roll and salmon belly but they never came. 

This sushi joint should be called So So Sushi since their food is just so so...

This place is so cool, my friends and I come here often and spend hundreds of dollars per visit for their AYCE which is great! This time however, our waitress Mayra, (so she never even gave us her name, we had to get it from the receipt and someone else btw) was extremely rude to us. When she came to our table she greeted us with a "What do you guys want?" And proceeded to roll her eyes because we needed a few extra minutes to decide, after 3 awkward exchanges where we were afraid to even ask our waitress for anything because of her attitude, we decided to try and make it go more smoothly for both parties involved but she actually gave us a reason for her rudeness when my friend asked her, "Did we do anything wrong?", "It's because you guys said you wanted 6 AYCE and AYCD and then you changed it to four." She said it as if miscommunication is a justification for being rude. I could not believe what I was hearing, at this point I simply asked for a different waiter, it makes no sense to spend nearly 300$ and be afraid of asking my waitress for service for fear of her rudeness. I love this place and I do recommend it as long as your waitress isn't the girl with the tattoo on on her neck. Word of advice: if people make you that miserable, you should probably not work in customer service. There are plenty of other places to work. Just saying.:-)

If you come in with a big party, you're sure to get time and attention from the servers. On the other hand, if you walk in with just one other person... They won't give you the time of day. 

I literally had to hunt the waiter down to give me a refill on my water. While he was there, he didn't even bother to refill my bf's empty cup of water. I guess he had to ask too. 

As I was eating one of the rolls, I pulled out a huge fish bone... I accidentally swallowed one and right then and there I was done. 

Not only did they neglect us, BUT the rice on the sushi was hard... NONE of the rolls were warm when they came to our table. I was pretty upset with our time here since I did find this place from yelp!

For sushi lovers like me and my family, and having been to Japan,  this place did not disappoint! Nigiri sushi are fresh, fried entrees are really satisfyingly good and service is fast. Staff are friendly especially the sushi chefs. Will come back very soon!

sushi is good but appetiser is awesome. we love salmon then we ordered many of them. salmon not sweet may be because it less fat. Uni is kind of tough, masago is a little bit salty. Other thing it perfect.

We used to go to this location a lot when it was Sushi on Summerlin.  They have new owners and have remodeled, and the whole vibe is pretty cool.  The main sushi chef is pretty awesome.  I should know his name by now, but he's a younger guy with a pony tail and he's excellent. 

We've been there a few times and now when we arrive, he already makes our favorites and we're served immediately.  

$5 all-you-can-drink draft Sapporo?!?  All day any day?!?   

I started coming here because the rude owner at Naka Sushi was so insulting, and I'm so glad I did.  Good food.  Good service.  Make sure you try the Sasa Roll.  And if you like spicy tuna...their extra spicy mix is the BOMB!!  They use tons of masago (Japanese caviar).

If you're craving AYCE sushi in the NW...I highly recommend Sasa over Naka.
I've been coming to this sushi place with my mom for years and my mom and her bestfriend have been coming for much longer than we have and we've never had a bad time. excellent sushi, great service.

My friend and I had dinner here last week. We ordered the AYCE and got the free sake for checking in. My favorite rolls were the Alex's Munchie and the Fire Roll. We tried the Paradise rolls as well, but I didn't like the flavor mix. We sat at the Sushi bar and the chef was cool and good company. I loved the Alex's Munchie so much, I ordered a second roll. I thought to myself, I'll definitely come back to this place again, good food, cool atmosphere, and as I take the final sip of my beer, from the corner of my eye I see something moving on the counter. I lean in closer and realize its a baby roach. I smash it with my napkin and tell the sushi chef. He calls one of the workers to come over and just then, another baby roach is crawling on the wall next to me. Talk about spoiling my whole experience. We managed to laugh it off, but on the inside I was dying. Had it not been for the roaches, I would have given 4 stars.

AWESOME!!!  My daughter and I have tried several sushi spots in the NW and have yet to find a good let alone great place.  The food was fresh and they give you options and will create something special for you, which I love.  The chefs and staff are friendly, happy and talented.  Finally a place we will go back to again.  :)

While on a trip in Vegas, I met up with some local friends who took me to this restaurant that they are fond of.  

I normally am not a sushi eater, but am willing to try different foods for the experience.  To my surprise, I loved it.  This was my third time ever eating sushi (I'm normally a edamame and chicken teriyaki girl), but everything was so delicious and the presentation was amazing.  Some of my favorites were the salmon belly, escolar nigiri, yellowtail, calamari, and the fried tofu. I thought the food paired very well with the sake that our server recommend, who by the way was on top of everything.  I never had to ask for more water, and he kept taking away the dishes as we finished.  Excellent service!  I always have to have dessert, and the strawberry mochi was a nice ending to the meal.  

Everyone working there seemed very friendly, and I really liked the decor.  I even enjoyed the music that was playing.

If I was a local this would definitely be on my rotation of places to go when I eat out.  On my next visit I will be sure to go again.

I think I got sick from this place. But it really wasn't bad at the time! It was good service expect we wanted to do half rolls and they told us "no" because they were too busy, even though their menu said we could. Ah well. I'd be willing to try them again but in the future. Not any time soon.

Out shopping with the wife, feeling hungry, and decided to get a bite to eat. YELP lists a decently rated AYCE sushi place close by, great.  As we drive up we realize we have done this before. No problem, the food wasn't  bad last time, so lets try again. 

Initial order arrived and once again no chopsticks, no napkins, no condiments. The food is good, but not special. Our server seemed surprised when we wanted to order additional sushi/rolls. Why would I pay for two AYCE if all I wanted was a couple of rolls and an appetizer?

The 18 fake/not recommended reviews are way sketchy.

Not a bad place for ayce sushi. Beside sushi was serve fast and delicious, yakitori and baked mussels are of the hook. Dessert is unlimited also unlike some of the ayce sushi places i have been. Service is not as welcoming. Smiley faces would have been nice with the greeting and service.

Came here for dinner with a few friends. Was not sure what to order so I went with the $25 "ALL YOU CAN EAT" ohhhh my goodddddddd what a great deal! And for $5 more u get unlimited beers as well! Service speed is great and you will get your money's worth! Definitely coming again!
The guys here are always awesome! Dinner and a show every time! They love to bs with all the costumers.
Excellent sushi for AYCE, we came on weekend lunch and service was excellent.  Thanks!
Good selection, nice atmosphere. Had to wait 30min on a Tuesday, totally worth it though
No matter what time of day it is service is always on point. Fish is always fresh. Sake is always hot. And jokes are always flowing. No matter how far away I move I will always drive to them for my

We came here about 4 pm on a Thursday after a day of hiking and there was only one other customer in the restaurant. We ordered many appetizers and rolls and they all tasted quite good. The quality was not bad in my opinion and the fish tasted fresh. The uni portion size was a bit small though. There is a limit of two orders of uni and/or sweet shrimp for the dinner AYCE. We ordered a lot of salmon/tuna nigiri and ordered a couple of the rolls, including kamikaze and birthday rolls. We also ordered the eel and soft shell crab hand roll which we thought was quite appetizing. The price was reasonable at $26/ person for dinner AYCE. Overall, I would come back to this restaurant because my family and I had a great time eating here. The service was excellent and not as bad as the other reviews say. The chefs tended to joke around with the other customers but it was cool. So come here if you want good service and quality fish! Worth! AYYYY

This is a great place to eat sushi. Came here some months ago, and the customer service is excellent. Everyone on their staff checks up on each of the tables. Everything tasted great. This was my first time coming here, and I would definitely recommend it to others.

First impression when we walked in: "oh it's empty but not too empty. We can probably get our food pretty quick." It's true, we did get it our orders quickly, but service was such a turn off. The server/waiter (a guy, the only guy.. maybe) was NOT attentive at all. The way he asks you what you want to drink or order is very straight forward. Literally, straight faced. He basically looks like he hates his job. Other than the terrible service, I actually enjoyed the food. Oysters, Super white, and Tracy II was amazing.  I'd most likely ONLY come back for those 3.
Surprisingly flavorful sushi.... Has to be one of the top sushi spots in Vegas off the strip.... Totally recommend.....

Sasa Sushi's AYCE option really filled me up for $21 (lunch price). A bargain when compared to some AYCE sushi restaurants in Las Vegas. 

Here's an overview of their AYCE:
There's a 45 minute time limit for lunch; 1 hour for dinner, I believe.
AYCE menu options are decent. Plenty of rolls and hot food items.
Excluding deep fried rolls, you can order 1/2 rolls.

FOOD
Pain in the Ass Roll:  The name did make me laugh out loud, so I had to order. I do like this roll, but I thought there was *too* much sauce on my plate.

Masago and Tako Nigiri: The masago was meager and not "robust" as others I've had. I do like how you can request quail eggs to top. The tako was too chewy and the rice vinegar for the sushi rice was strong, so I didn't enjoy the flavor-texture combination.

Japanese Lasagna: I thought there was too much cheese. It's difficult for me to figure out if there was too much cheese in the rolls or on top -- both, maybe? But being a cheese lover, even that was excessive.

Unnamed Roll: The sushi chef created two pieces of sushi for us on the fly. The pieces had imitation crab on top of rice and were wrapped with a thin slice of tuna, which kind of reminded me of bacon. Not bad, we enjoyed it.

SC 7 Roll: The roll is wrapped with soy paper and has drops of srirracha sauce on top. I thought I would like this roll, but the flavors didn't meld well. As much as I love srirracha, I thought it was what threw the flavors off-balance. 

Tempura Ice Cream: Tempura battered vanilla ice cream served with chocolate syrup and a spray of whipped cream. Didn't care for the texture of the thick tempura shell. I also thought this was underwhelming when compared to the tempura ice cream that RA sushi has, which is the best one I've had so far in Las Vegas. 

SERVICE
The service here is terrific. Staff is friendly, competent, and attentive. 

OTHER
Sushi that isn't tightly rolled = contents will fall out. 

Maybe I'm just being picky, but one of the rolls ordered wasn't arranged neatly. I bring this up because I've before never seen sushi rolls presented sloppily. It reminds me of what my plate looks like when I hit up a sushi buffet and grab sushi pieces and plop them onto my plate. 

OVERALL
My rating for Sushi Sasa  is a 3.5/5.0. The service is wonderful and the price for the AYCE lunch is awesome. The rolls are fine, but I wouldn't order the same items again.

The happy hour special from 2-5 on week days is 20% off all rolls. The food is the best sushi I've ever had. The Orange Tiger is my personal favorite but we've never had a bad roll. Three of us ate for $50 during happy hour. They also offer an all you can eat lunch $21, dinner $25.

Best sushi bar in Vegas with the best sushi and the best staff.
Gotta love the workers and the sushi
This is our family favorite sushi place. Fresh foods, home feeling, and great prices. Thumbs up for this special place

Never to come back to this place ever again!!! Fish quality bad service ok that's why we tip $24 dollars for only two people eating AYCE!!! That's 47% in tip alone! When I show the server joe about the free sake order for checking in with yelp he seam so surprise!!! He also mention if you buy the cook beers they will make our sushi experience/cooking better??? Lmfao so we paid $80 total for two AYCE including tip!!!

I mean I'm just speaking my opinion that's all pardon me if I offended anyone! But for real for the price!!! Fish quality and each time we order something we always got short!!! Ordered salmon roe we never got it they keep saying the stuff still frozen I mean come on now that just BS!!! they said takes time but they never did bring out salmon roe order out! Order shrimp tempura it said on the menu 5 pieces per order server joe bring out only 2 tempura shrimp!!! 

It is what it is but that stuff is BS to us!!!

I love trying new sushi places, especially All You Can Eat ones. However, I have stopped searching. This is it. Every time I go I am amazed at how FRESH the fish is. I love nigiri and they give you a generous slice of fish with minimal rice. I hate when places load up on rice and place a tiny piece of fish on top. 

The staff is always friendly and welcoming. I always really, really enjoy my experience here. Can I come back tomorrow??

Friendly service, but I've had better.

Upon entering, the place itself was quite inviting, and the staff couldn't have been friendlier! 

However, it took way too long for us to get our sushi and the sushi rice seemed a bit off (as if it had just come from the fridge or was overcooked).
Great service from Chris! Nice big friendly smile,very attentive. Dessert hit the spot with they're delicious green tea ice cream

They are RUDE RUDE RUDE!!!  We had a female waitress, only female there, who lacked manners. We sat down and she brought us the menus, she immediately asked for our order. We order drinks and asked her to give us a second to pick the roles, she replied, (I'M NOT LYING) "Ok as long as is not too long, since is Friday and we get busy, we might have to ask you to leave if you don't order soon"... So we laughed, thought it was a joke, right? No it wasn't, she had a straight serious face...  

Later, she came back to take our order, we had AYCE. Sushi was okay, nothing memorable. Earlier, when we placed our drink order she suggested $5 all you can drink beer, so my friend got that. When he finish his first glass of beer we asked the waiter for a refill, when she brought the sushi, which she replied (AGAIN, not lying) "hmm I might have to ask someone else to bring it to you because I am not going to be in this side (restaurant & it is not big by any means) for a while"... She left to attend other tables. She never asked anyone to bring that drink. Some other guy, helped us for the rest of the night, he was slow but  not rude...so it was an improvement. At one point during the night they brought us the wrong sushi rolls, when we told some other waiter that it wasn't ours he did not said a thing, just picked them up and left. 

Let me clarify I am not a difficult customer and I always tip, this was the first time I withheld a tip. PLEASE spend your precious money elsewhere :)

Wow this place is nice. Service is fast the rolls are really good. Make reservations on weekends cause it gets busy. Try the pain in the ass roll; the rolls have unique names. Its definitely a must visit

Is it magical? Like a rainbow unicorn on a Hawaiian sunset? Probably not, but it's everything you'd want out of a sushi place. Food is fresh, flavorful, good fish to rice ratio. Service is outstanding. Staff is professional, yet not stuck up. Pretty quick, too. Empty plates or glasses never stuck around for long. 
Definitely try the poke salad, excellent seasoning, it's got a nice kick to it. 
Oh, and Erin, the server, is awesome! :)

Truly a gem, great service and food! 
My boyfriend and I drove 20 minutes out of the strip for dinner when we were visiting Vegas for the weekend and it was so worth it. The fish was fresh and at a good price. The experience wouldn't have been as great if the sushi chef wasn't so kind! He even created a little mouse out of an orange for us since we were going to EDC!
Absolutely in love with this place! Gotta try the SSS and alex's munchies if stopping by. People are nice and the food is always on point.

So me and my mom went there where we were greeted by the nicest guys. We weren't sure what to order so nick asked us a few questions and proceeded to give us plate after plate. EVERYTHING he gave us was amazing especially the tracie ll.  Our experience and dinner was so much fun we will for sure be going back very soon!
Pretty good service close to home!!! Looovvvveeee the yum yum sauce!! It's rad also not a long wait and comparable prices!!!!

It is very rare that I give a place a 1-star review, but given the circumstances, it must be done. Here is why..

1. We walked in asking for a table for 6 and the server immediately asked us "Is this your first time here?" We replied with "Yes." You know, thinking she was going to be like "Oh, welcome!! We're so happy to have you with us tonight!" Instead, she responded with, "Oh, next time, can you just make sure you call in to let us know that you have a big group coming in? As you can see we're quite small so it will just be better for both of us if you called in..." Did I not just tell her that it was our first time? Was I supposed to know that you were a small restaurant? I thought this was like any typical restaurant that I can walk in with a party of 6 and you can accommodate us, even if it meant for us to wait a little? o_O? 

2. I checked in on Yelp and received a free sake, and what's some sake without some Asahi amirite? So we order a bottle of Asahi. Almost regrettable because it completely confused the crap out of the server and had her asking her coworker if that was allowed multiple times. Back and forth she went asking questions and thinking we were looking for a free bottle of Asahi with our sake when we repeatedly told her we just wanted to order a beer with our sake..! Just take my money already and give us the bottle of Asahi! 

3. The server continued to remind us she was new. The first time was a pass and understandable, but mistake after mistake after mistake and the excuse of being new does not fly with me. I give you the benefit of the doubt that you're a smart cookie, you don't have to keep telling me that you're new. I understood the first time. Just do better. And by better, I don't mean spilling water on our phones...which is exactly what she did -___-" ohh laawwd. 

4. The upside and downside is that if you wanted any roll wrapped with cucumber you can do so, but only ONE roll when you're doing the AYCE option. Bummer because those are the only type of rolls I fancy. 

5. Obviously our server wasn't favorable but just in general I feel like the place is rather small where all servers are taking care of all tables. I personally like to have one attentive server when I dine because then you run into multiple servers asking you if you're doing okay in 5 minute rotations. But that wasn't the problem here, it just seemed like no one was being attentive. If possible, just dine at the sushi bar so you can get your orders in right away and not have to deal with that mess.

6. Lastly, the reason why I'm like EEK! Methinks not! about Sasa is because I don't live in this area and don't see myself driving 20 minutes to visit here again. The food was OK but the service is really what left the bad taste in my mouth.

I called prior to leaving my home and asked what time they close. A female said "last call is at 10:15 but if you can make it here before then, you'll be fine". My family and I arrived by 10 pm sharp and they wouldn't let us in and said they were closed, WHEN IT WAS ONLY 10Pm. They just lost our business forever.  2/20/17 at 10pm

Great food, atmosphere and service and close to home!  So glad we found this place.

We had the AYCE and had the uni, amaebi, salmon belly, besides others and we were impressed with the freshness and the small size of the rice.  Some places make the nigiri with too much rice to fill you up but these were just right.  They even fried up the amaebi head without us asking.  A very pleasant dining experience and would highly recommend this place.

Nothing special. I've had better AYCE elsewhere but it was decent. The fish was rather bland; the only thing my boyfriend and I really enjoyed was the poke. THAT was delicious. Otherwise, it was pretty lackluster.

This review is regarding the Yelp Order Online option for Sasa Sushi. I ordered the food 1.5 hours before the restaurant closed, paid via credit card and received email confirmation for pick up within 10-30 minutes.

Showed up at the restaurant 20 minutes after placing the order and the restaurant wasn't open, and likely was closed for some time since there were no staff closing the restaurant, everyone had left already.

I can only assume they closed early cuz it was dead, but now I paid for food, it was late at night and I was stuck trying to figure out what was still open for dinner and how I was going to get my money back. 

I called the restaurant to get a refund and they've redirected me to Yelp, who I guess has Eat24 run their online orders. So we'll see how it goes.

So I would not recommend using their online ordering service if it's even a couple hours before the restaurant closes, because they may not be open when you try to pick up your food.

Edit: eat24 responded promptly with a refund.

I used to come here all the time and it was great! The last couple of times I've gone the place was filthy, there was a cockroach on the wall... Menus are never wiped down and have sticky sauce all over them and the service has gone way downhill. They might have changed management or something? Then tonight I decided to give one last shit. I walked in and sat down at 9:10 and the waitress came to tell me it was last call in 5 minutes... Why would you need to tell a customer it's last call coming up 50 minutes before you close?

Very good sushi, great veggie choices, cozy seating and fun waiter.  We will be back for sure and we will recommend this place to our family and friends.  We have eaten at many sushi restaurants in Vegas and this place I by far the BEST!

This is the third time I have been here and I have to say each time was just as delicious or more delicious than the last. The family and I used to go to a few other places and stumbled upon sasa while looking for a place closer to our house. I highly recommend the birthday roll! It has everything you could want all in one roll. We always order two when we come. I have yet to try anything that isn't delicious and the chefs special had been beyond amazing every time. If you're looking for a place in the northwest come and eat at sasa sushi. It's delicious and they have great service!

My friend just purchased a home nearby.  We were staying at their place.  Ate here the day we flew into Vegas.  Hit the spot.  Refreshing, great service and good portions.  Competitive prices.  They have a $30 all you can eat sushi, I can't eat that much and I don't eat meat, so doesn't work for me.  As a vegetarian, they had some really good options, I was a happy camper.  For sure going back on my next Vegas trip.

My boyfriend and I came here around 730 on Sunday, the restaurant was busy but not packed. The hostesses were warm and welcoming in fact the whole staff was very friendly throughout the meal. Our sushi chef manny was the star of the show though awesome service from him; he made recommendations and answered all our questions. I especially enjoyed the tuna carpaccio and salmon belly.. We tried to stay away from rice for the most part but the sasa roll and paradise roll are very good!! The only thing I wasn't too fond of was my soft shell crab hand roll, I shouldn't of deviated from my normal tuna. All in all we def enjoyed eating here and big thanks to manny for his service!

sushi wasn't expensive but wasn't the best I've had in town 
prob won't go back since I know I like other places more

We had all you can eat sushi. We were able to order any of the rolls that we wanted which was nice. They have a card with "rules" including a time limit on the table which was a little weird. All of your food was amazing. We ended up sharing 5 different rolls through our meal and were happy with all of them. Overall it would have been a 5 star review if our server had seemed happier to be helping us.
Good quality for All you can eat! Free sake with check in! Huge selection on rolls and nigiri! I am really impressed with this place that's close to my house. It's a must try!

I was disappointed in the quality and size of the rolls. Tons of rice and the fish didn't taste good. I didn't enjoy a single roll I ate while doing all you can eat. They advertise half order rolls but the half orders are the largest sushi rolls I have ever seen. I don't often leave places feeling ripped off, but that was my impression.

Quality of food is great, good options, and decent service.

Came here for a quick lunch with a few friends because one of them lives in the area. It is far from city center but for me it was worth the drive. The lunch price of $21.95 is very limited and does not have sweet shrimp or uni, so we paid extra for the dinner option at lunch just so we can get the specialty items. The specialty items were still only 1 order per person. 

The sashimi plates were awesome! One of the very few places that does sashimi for all your can eat. The pieces were smaller, but still very fresh. The sushi were pretty good, rice size is about average. The rolls were ok, some hits and some misses. The free sake with Yelp check-in is great!!

Service was decent, bathrooms were clean. If I was in the area, I definitely would come back.

My husband got really sick from eating here. Called 3 times and spoke with the manager who said the owners would call him back. They never called. My husband is a Chef on the strip and as the saying goes...if someone has a good experience, they tell 2 people, if they have a bad experience, they tell 20. Bad move management.

Went there last night to celebrate my best friends birthday. Sushi was delicious and they kept the drinks coming! We were unsure about which rolls to get and Ron offered to make us a few surprise rolls. He just asked if we had any allergies and how we felt about spice levels and came back with a tray of deliciousness! They also prepared a special ice cream desert for my bestie without us even asking! Great time, great food and great service. I'll definitely be going back

First time we were there was awesome. Best sushi in a while and ended up the server was also the owner. She was very nice. Came back another weekend and it was a disaster. Waiting and waiting and waiting. Average 20-30 minutes between rolls and they came out one at a time. They were loosely rolled and chefs decided to change recipes. Rolls had no flavor and lost our appetite waited so long. The owners weren't there and the server has the worst attitude. He never smiles and is not a people person. Reached out to the owner on Facebook and she never wrote back. Won't be back.

My husband and I were looking for a "new" sushi place to frequent when we were unhappy with the place by our home. We drove a little further and tried Sasa Sushi and we were very happy we did!  We loved it! Manny, the sushi chef, was friendly and took the time to talk to us about the different fish and made us a few special dishes. The fish was so fresh. We watched him cut it away from the skin. We felt like we were treated with love and we will defiantly go back! It's so nice to go out to dinner and feel like you got MORE than you paid for. A++. We have a new favorite!
had dinner with friends ... Food is great and good portion. This is our third time here and all our orders were excellent!!!  Will be back again....

The sushi is always as fresh as possible and taste is on point.  I would love to give 5 stars, but getting a servers attention is consistently an issue.  At least they're super friendly when they do get to you :)
Such an awesome place!  The staff is great, friendly and accommodating. My new favorite place on this side of town!
Great service and Nick is a sushi master. I just asked him to surprise me and he delivered. Sushi is awesomely fresh and everyone is friendly!!

Awesome sushi, unbelievable price!

Well I'm lucky enough to have family in Vegas so I can find some awesome off strip/local favorites.

First they have an All You Can Eat option for less than 30 bucks

The sushi here is amazing. The rolls are very creative and super delicious.

Service is friendly and sushi rolls at made fresh to order.

If you're wanting a dinner to eat and dash don't come here. This spot is real sushi,  made by real sushi chefs. This food is meant to be enjoyed and takes time to create. Our dinner from beginning to end was around 45 minutes.

Must Try when in Vegas

Love this place. Always a great time. Start off with a Sasa roll and some pork belly. Have some fresh nigiri midcourse, and finish it up with a Pain in the Ass roll. Great atmosphere and love it each time we're here.

This place is GREAT. I wasn't too sure when I first showed up because it took about 7 minutes of us sitting there to be acknowledged. There weren't that many people there. But once the food came out it didn't matter. It was amazing. The playboy roll was by far the best one. We ordered 2 of them. Overall it was great. Would definitely reccomend.

Ok, I gotta say SASA disappointed me a more than just a little bit during my last two visits. I was so excited about the new Sushi place and I think I will even give it one more chance. 

Both times my order was incomplete so I had to keep asking for the same thing. It gets more irritating when they forget it again. It might be that they were very busy but this would never happen at Sushi Koma on the south side of Vegas or Sushi goyemon, probably one of the busiest AYCE sushi joint in town. 

The biggest thing though, and this is serious, the fish quality has been very inconsistent. The scallop tastes very dried and the salmon is sometimes hard to digest. What offended me during one of my last twos visits was that the salmon came with whole bunch fish bones in it. This is unacceptable in a sushi restaurant. Also, the sushi rice kept on falling apart and the rice tasted very dried and blend. While I do not expect a 5 star sushi experience at a AYCE place, I do expect the basics are met. Having bones appear in your sushi is just embarrassing imo. 

I really love the people here and sasa was really good when i first tried it. I am willing to give it another chance and i hope things will get back to what they were used to be.
Never a bad AYCE visit!! Great fresh variety, it's not all deep fried like other AYCE places. Sit at the bar, the sushi chefs are very entertaining.

pretty good fish. the nigiri sushi servings were a bit small but we had all you can eat so it didn't matter. the chef was fantastic!  suggested some great stuff. 5$ all you can drink. love this place. good food and great service.
